reviews.review: A pretty park for a Sunday stroll. Regent's Park is a well maintained, pretty park with a cute little coffee shop that we were able to duck into out of a rain shower.

Ooooooo pretty!. You could spend a day in here, its huge with lots of things to see. When we went it was a nice day and certainly a good Pokemon Go spot (oh yes we did) very photogenic and seemed to be a few bits and pieces going on. 100% recommend.
Good one. One of the many parks in London. After Hyde park, I will vote for this one as one of the beautiful parks of London. Must Visit
Lots to do in the fresh air. Bigger than I expected. Lots of geese and ducks. Felt miles away from bustle of the city. Cafes a bit pricey

away from the noise.. Just afew minutes walk from marybone road and the peace was great lovely walks and plenty of coffee shop boat rides the gardens are very well tended well worth spending time there.
beautiful with a lot of attractions. I was able to spend the whole day without being bored even for a second, zoo, boat to rent, football field, cafes and the best: musical theatre!

5 hours of pleasant walking. Having left my better half to enjoy her cookery course I whiled away the hours meandering around Regents Park. There's lots to see including arts, sports, gardens and cafes.
Fantastic nature experience.. Rowing at the lake. Jogging both Inner Circle and Outer Circle is nice. Lots of nice birds. A fantastic nature experience.
A wonderful Park. A wonderful park , in oktober 2016 we were there during the frieze sculpture park ,a great bonus for us

lots going on. Walked from end to end , plenty of things going on , plus plants ,trees, water fountains.
Sometime displays, sculpture are some time on display. Little or no traffic aoart from some roads to cross.
Wonderful place to walk. Great rose garden, water, ducks, great place for a wander. You can exit by the canal and then have a nice walk along the bank of the canal.

A nice peaceful interlude. We went for a walk through Regents Park with our seven-year old granddaughter and came across the paddleboat rides. They charge in half-hour increments and per person, which can quickly add up. That said, our 30-minute outing was enjoyable and a nice way to view the park while getting a little exercise.

One of my favorite places in the world. Vast grass areas, trees and shrubs and flowers in season make this place a garden of eden for Avid gardeners like me... I often take pictures to get. Lever ideas of matching colours and shapes.The pond is a joy for children rowing little boats.I afore the open air theatre in the summer although many times I got showered from a sudden rain. I love sitting in the small cafeteria where you. An fill in your phone battery. And above all, the queen rose garden which is breath taking in the summer. All in all it is a bliss.

Favorite Park in London!. I honestly didn't plan on walking around here long. I stopped by Baker Street to visit the Sherlock Holmes museum and I thought I would just stop by to have a looky-loo. I SPENT 3 HOURS THERE. I was just fascinated by it all. It was quiet, with not many people around. Great experience! The grounds are nicely kept with beautiful landscaping and wildlife.

Majestic park. The Regent park is a huge one but lovely, lots of lakes, gardens with flowers even in autumn, beautiful sculptures. We managed to walk around and climbed the Primrose Hill with fantastic views of the London in around three hours!
Beautiful Landscapes. London has many gardens and parks but this one is very well maintained and is landscaped unlike the others. This is little far from many of the attractions.

My favorite park in London. I have been recommending this park to everyone who visit London. The Queen's Rose garden (Mar-Jun) is such a beautiful experience that one can spend hours together sitting and watching the 400+ variety of roses...The walks and benches are also good. People also cycle around the place.
Beautiful. Well kept, beautiful and child friendly. Such pretty plants and great facilities. Park cafe very expensive though.
Amazing park. Super park. Very manicured. Totally different from hampstead heath and well worth a visit. Not the best park for dogs because they are quite restricted here

An Everything Park. Regents Park has everything one could look for. It has wide green expanses, unique water and flower gardens, fountains, rose gardens, stunning fences, cafes and ice cream, a lake, waterfowl and squirrels, busy and not-so busy walking paths, and views. It's simply one of the best parks in the city, and allows tourists a break from the lines and the crowds and the noise, without spending a cent if they so choose.I intend on returning, again and again, but even before this trip of mine ends.

Haven away from the city streets. This is a beautiful park, ideal for those looking for a quiet stroll to admire the flowers or water fowl on the lake, or to have a picnic, hire a boat or pedals for an hour, or for children to enjoy the playground. It is used for playing sports and by runners. There is also a running track.You can also access the canal from the park and also stroll to the top of Primrose Hill to enjoy the view of the city.

Beautiful Park. Regent's Park is really beautiful and stretches all the way from Primrose Hill to Baker Street, meaning you can have a really nice Long walk. Make sure you bring a smartphone or camera as the park is really photogenic.

A nice stroll in the park while visiting madam tusade. Visited madame tussade and decided to go to Regent Park.. it was a lovely experience in a cool weather.. I highly recommend doing it.. The view of the ducks and squirrels are so wonderful
Serene. The park is very serene and perfectly maintained. I do love English style gardens and this is a lovely example.

Beautiful park to take a walk and relax when in London!. I really enjoyed my walks through Regents Park. Last year, I visited the Park several times - including when I attended Frieze London. Frieze is an *event*. It’s not your typical visit to a museum or art gallery. When you arrive, you are surrounded by beautiful people and wannabe beautiful people. I felt a bit out of place as I observed all of the beautiful people interactions around me. I preferred the beauty on the walls to that in the corridors. Personally, I liked strolling through Regents Park instead of being in the Frieze tent. The outdoor Frieze exhibits were incredible and worked well in the peaceful, manicured grounds of Regents Park. Accordingly, my rating is for Regents Park as a whole and not for Frieze London.

Our favorite garden and London treasure!. We spend as much time as possible here when we come to London. It was designed by John Nash for the Prince Regent in 1811. Queen Mary's Garden was opened to the public in 1932 and contain roses, roses and more roses. It is a rose lover's dream. But that's not all. The connecting landscape garden is stunning with water features and birds.

A walk in the park for our walking group. As a change of venue was needed from Hyde Park, we chose Regent's Park for our monthly walk. It was full of spring flowers and small cafes to stop for a drink or light lunch. Lots to look at.

Visit Primrose Hill and open air theatre. We were there at a sunny sunday afternoon and especially primrose hill with the stunning view at London was great. Great for relaxing and strolling around. Maybe there's a concert going in the open air theatre like when we vistied a klezmer concert
Nice park to walk through. Beautiful park that is kept well. Nice areas to sit and relax to get away from it all. Nice to see a clean park in the middle of the city.
Lovely views . Huge park with beautiful views of London city from the top of primrose hill.Lots to do and plenty of parking at a weekend in the surrounding streetsWorth a visit if you're in the area

Relaxing open air retreat from the heat and pace of London .... Simply excellent grounds and refreshment is available in a busy but well organised café. A must for those looking for a different side of London from the shops and busy tourist sights. Access via Great Portland Street or Baker Street tube stations.
Love it. I love regent park as it's quieter than Hyde park.. It's smaller but still not small, plenty of activities.

Beautiful park with lots of interest. Regent's Park and its immediate surrounds are a lovely place to wander and let the world go by. The park itself is beantifully cared for and is well used by those interested in horticultural, sport or people simple out enjoying a wander or a family picnic! The architecture of the immediately surrounding area is also of genuine interest and of a stunning scale that makes a real impression.The facilities within the park are well looked after and of good quality and is accessible.A really great experience however long or short a time you have to spend here.
Beautiful. Very well kept, beautiful features, we took a gentle stroll through on the way to and from the zoo. Stopped for a while just to enjoy our surroundings. A great place to relax and play.

Favorite park in London. By far the best park in London, it is not big as Hyde park, that's true, but I consider it is the prettiest one around London, lots of flowers, ducks, swoons, and it is accesible too!! sadly I dont have pictures anymore but I recommend you to check it out.

Lovely Romantic walk.... Following Madame Tussaud's, Regents Park is a stones Throw away. The gardens here are well manicured and taken care of. Nothing out of place. The park is quiet and ideal for a respite from the hustle bustle of the city streets. Plenty of open space to sit down with a picnic and watch the world go by. If you are hungry, there are restaurants and cafes dotted around the park....if you have money to burn then £4 for a slice of cake is no hardship. Otherwise, bring a picnic and a flask of coffee.Bring your camera, and enjoy as much as you can of the flora and fauna on offer. We particularly enjoyed 'the inner circle'...worth a visit any time. There is a Zoo located at the top of the park, don't miss this if Zoos are your thing.
Nicest large park in London. Beautiful rose gardens and other flower gardens and beautiful borders with surrounding neighborhoods.

Rose Garden. The best. I probably visit london more than a hundred times and spent i do not know how many days in the last twenty five years. I am ashamed to discover this place so late. It is a fantastic place with close to a hundred rose variety named and grown purposely. The small streak and black swans and other birds gliding over adds to the entertainment. September was s late month for watching the roses as they were past their glory however still fantastic. I recommend a may-june visit to really indulge.

My Favourite Royal Park. Amazing place to visit, lots to see and beautiful scenery. This place offers boating as well and has the beautiful Regents Mosque close by. However I rented a bike and hoped to cycle through the park only to realise that there are only certain areas you can cycle through in this park. Overall a lovely, peaceful place to see.
For me this is the best park in London.. Such a wonderful and tranquil place to take a stroll or just sit and look. There is a lot of it so you might want to keep coming back to see more.

beautiful rose garden. You'll find the rose garden in the inner circle of the park. It is a great joy to discover the different varieties of roses the like of which I haven't seen anywhere else.
A must for Rose lovers.
nice park. A park with great space,especially if you enjoy your sports and the plus side of being right next to London zoo.
Quiet park still in bloom. Flowers, even roses, still in bloom in the quiet park. Many places to sit and enjoy nature because dogs, bicycles and ball playing are prohibited.

Beautiful Rose Gardens. We really enjoyed the space of the gardens, at times it felt like we were totally on our own. The rose gardens were beautiful & a definite favourite, if only we could create landscaping that lovely back home. Plenty of green space, sporting fields & areas to picnic.
Regents Park. Now this is one park worth a walk through whatever the weather and take a sandwich and coffee too. Sandwich's for the squirrels, the coffee's for you.!!!

Favourite London Park . So good, lots of variety- lake, quiet gardens, space for kids to run around, it has it all.
Best London Park in my opinion

Beautiful park. Such a nice walk through Regents Park in the summer. People are all out and enjoying themselves. Couldn't help but think of Virginia Woolf walking through the same manicured park whilst writing Mrs. Dalloway. Really wonderful place to visit.

Beyond beautiful!. What a spectacular park! Great place for a leisure stroll or jog. So very many places to sit and take in the foliage. One word of warning, if you are eating in the park protect your good. The seagulls are very bold hungry birds and think nothing of snatching your food from your lap. Be sure to check out the magnificent rose gardens. We went several times to walk off dinner!

One of the most beautiful parks in London. went to regents park for a family day out. it was amazing. there were things for everyone to do. for example there was a children's play are where the children could enjoy themselves and there was a beautiful rose garden with many different flowers for other members of a family to enjoy. also there were boats which could be hired to ride. and if you are not into any of that then there is masses of open spaces where you can catch some rays of even play that game of football or cricket or maybe its Frisbee you like. basically there is something for everyone and definitely somewhere everyone needs to visit.
A Peaceful Park. A nice park to visit. Spacious and well-designed. Lots to do. I recommend renting a bike, as the park is very big and would take hours to walk.

Beautiful walk through Regents Park.. We walked from London Zoo all the way through Regents Park on a spring afternoon and it was lovely to see the people sat enjoying the gardens and expansive greenery in the city.

So Peaceful and A Nice Break From The City Noise!. So Peaceful and A Nice Break From The City Noise! If you have time, just take a stroll through. There are beautiful flowers, paths to walk, lakes, birds and ducks, and a nice little cafe in the middle. It gives you a nice and peaceful view of London.

Perfect day out spot on a sunny day. if you are in London and like to relax and enjoy a beautiful well kept garden then please visit Regent's park .... it's a perfect place if you are visiting London with kids or family. You can spend an afternoon stroll around and there are some cafes if you like to snack up or get thirsty.
Favourite park. Wonderful park. Outdoor theatre in the summer. Always well maintained. Excellent for jogging and strolling.
Amazing park. Amazing park for a romantic walk. It is calm and perfect for a memorable moment of pure relaxation. Loved this place.
A special place. Here you can get away from the traffic for a while, and you can enjoy the architecture of some of the finest buildings in the world.

Walk back from Abbey Road to your hotel. It's a bit of a hike to walk from Abbey Road to our hotel, but the park made the walk relaxing and beautiful. It is a peaceful place to spread out and get away from the crowded streets. But no means is this park lonely, but there is more room to share space
squirrel's paradise. Very pleasant place to have a nice walk with a friend, to seat and chill out. Plenty of joyful bushy-tailed grey cuties.

Great boating experience. I have visited Regent's Park on many occasions over the years and it is possibly my no. 1 park in London, but today, for the first time, my 10-year old son and I hired a pedalo for an hour and went round the lake. It was a very pleasant way of experiencing the park and the wildlife. The weather was beautiful and we got there around noon, before it got too crowded. Unfortunately we had just missed the early bird offer which applies before noon, but at least we didn't have to queue.I'd certainly recommend the experience and opting for one hour instead of half an hour, gives you enough time to leisurely go round the small island a couple of times. There is a small kids only pedalo in a pond next to the boat hire as well as a good playground with sand and climbing frames. To find the larger playground you need to walk across St Mary's Gardens and out the other side and then head south. It lies in the South-East corner of Regents Park and has sand, climbing frames, slides, swings and water feature. The park got uncomfortably crowded in the afternoon and we chose to leave. Next time we pay Regent's Park a visit we'll try to get there earlier in the day and catch the early bird rate and maybe we'll even be brave enough to try the rowboat.
Take the time to go through the Park. While visiting Buckingham palace, take the time to stroll through the adjoining park. It was one of the favorite places of Princess Diana. Lovely views.

Away from the hustle and bustle . On visits to London we almost always end up here at some point. Yes there are other parks in town, but this one suits us.You can lose the crowds and breath.Ok it's not as exciting or as picture perfect as Central Park in New York, but it has its own charm and shouldn't be over looked.If your looking for a couple of hours relaxing away from the crowds, this is the place to head.
Beautiful . We loved this park with large display of beautiful flowers. Huge open green space also. The cafe is nice with a picnic basket you can purchase. Great day out. Must visit.

Wonderful Walks to and in the Park. We have visited Regents Park twice this year on a day visit to London by train and tube and via Regents canal firstly to see the wonderful Rose Gardens and secondly to visit the Outdoor Theatre. You would never believe you were in a city most of the time !!!!

Beautiful park, perfect for a break during a busy day (work or travel). I happened to work not far away from Regent's Park and whenever I had a chance to have a bit of time for lunch during the summer I would eat it there, enjoying this beautiful park.It is splendidly arranged and can definitely be a nice break during any visit of London and will bring a bit of calm and serenity during your day. Well worth the visit.

Park Perfection. Regents Park has it all. Cafes to sit at, fields to run around in, matches to watch being played by local cricket teams, and of course London Zoo. It's very well looked after and perfect for those looking for some peace and calm.

Open air theatre. Visited in the evening for an open air performance of Pride and Prejudice, but found the park itself to be beautiful. My short journey took me straight to the inner circle, but what a journey it was. Happened to be nearing sunset, and that provided for stunning scenes across the grass and water. Walking over the bridge surrounded by willow trees and ducks was truly like something out of a novel.
one of many parks. Reents park is just a fun place to picnic, feed squirrels, hang out. beautiful park in central london,
Nice Park. This is one of londons gems, a great park to relax and rest from a weary day of sightseeing. I would recommend it as a nice picnic spot too.
Lovely park. Lovely to walk through. A gorgeous green space in London with the added attraction of the zoo if fancy it.
Nice quite place. I have visit regents park few times when i used to live near London.Its nice place for time out from hustle and bustle of london,great area to run or walk.

Stunner of a Park...home to the Zoo!. Love, love, love this park. It is BIG and it is a destination. Love just walking...seeing people talking, walking, playing. Home to the Zoo as well. A great and iconic British park.

Stunning. Absolutely breathtakingly beautiful walk through regents park. The flowers were all in bloom, the trees a haven to shelter under from the hot Sun, a fantastic statue where you can get ice cold water from. There are loads of benches to take your weight so you can observe the magnificent views. A truly stunning place.

Prettiest park in London !!. This park, which is within walking distance from Baker's street Tube station is a hidden gem in London. A must visit for nature lovers! Early morning joggers/walkers abound here. The flowers, the pond with the water birds and swans, and the open spaces are really beautiful. A great mix of landscaped garden and open natural spaces.
great for morning run. Part was great for morning run.Fresh crisp air, close to where I was staying. Not too crowded. Very good.

Includes london zoo at the north of the park. On sunny days this can get crowded despite being such a large park and you should be prepared to walk along the 'roads' through the middle but it is refreshing break from shopping or other sight seeing - there is even a university in the grounds (not open to public)

Beautiful grounds and great stroll or long walk . The park is located near the Pancras Station - about 15 minute walk away - and a great place to spend a few hours, or a day. We strolled through the major gardens within the park (there are several) and walked by the zoo for a long walk. We were there for three hours and had a delightful afternoon with not-so-much pedestrian traffic for a Friday. Rest rooms are available but pence are needed for admission so one is advised to have pence available as change may not be at some locations. Concessions are widely scattered but available. The grounds and gardens are manicured and delightful to visit.
Well Worth a Visit. On a sunny day, this is well worth a visit. It is well looked after and there is so much space that you do not feel it is crowded even on a sunny day. Take a picnic and enjoy !

Worth a visit. Great park plenty benches to sit on and lovely flower gardens and Great Lakes and ducks swans on it one of the lakes had a small old bridge over it I thought to myself what a great place to propose to someone very romantic

Visit Queen Mary's Rose Garden for beautiful roses!. I visited this park as an unplanned stop of my day. I entered through the gate that put me right in Queen Mary's Rose Garden, and it was just breathtaking. I couldn't spend too much time outside because it was raining, but I spent a few minutes by a beautiful fountain. I then found a little island with great views and hardly anyone around. I also ran into a wedding photography session! It's a nice little break from the bustling city, I definitely recommend it!

Massive park. This park is vast with a great walking trail along the water. There are boating towards as well. There are several pitch fields and a lovely garden, Much to an expats surprise there is a trapeze school that is very reasonable priced that offers two hour classes it is the whip!!!
Breathtaking views!. The park looks very royal with a lovely fountain accompanied by scenic views as well as a river. I also played Pokemon go with family here and it was perfect for magikarps!

A fascinating park. This huge park wit area of more than four hundred acres is best known for hosting the famous London Zoo. But, here you can also find a beautiful lake, playgrounds and sport courts, a large open-air theatre and many other amenities. The park is named after Prince Regent who became the King George IV, who appointed the famous architect John Nash to create a masterplan for the whole area in the early 19th century.

Lovely Park. We enjoyed this park and came twice during our stay. The rose gardens are beautiful and the children enjoyed the playgrounds and the open spaces. We also ate at the Regent's Bar and Kitchen for breakfast and stopped there again for a cider.

Indeed a Great Park to take a rest, walk through, bike or have kids play. We walk through the park almost daily, at times along the canals, past the zoo, or stop at the smokehouse or the cafe. A friend visiting from Zurich enjoyed most the 'Ready Money' Drinking Fountain - a monument donated by a generous Zoroastrian philanthropist from India Sir Jehangir Cowasjee (his nickname was Ready Money) in 1869. The fountain sculpture contains 10 tonnes of Sicilian marble and four tonnes of red Aberdeen granite. It was unveiled by Princess Mary of Teck, later Queen Mary after whom Queen Mary's Gardens are named.

A treat for all, children included .... Regent's Park is enormous, so we only enjoyed two specific areas - the Diana Memorial Playground and the pedal boating. The children (4 and 6) adored both, but especially the pedal boating with mama providing the momentum (boys too short to reach the pedals, even on the child-sized individual boats. The water is clean, the ducks are friendly, the snacks are great, and a happy hour or half hour on the lake is a peaceful interlude for tourists and residents alike.
Day visit with family. Such a beautiful park even on a cold day. The wild birds are beautiful. Such a relaxing afternoon there in between visiting the surrounding area. Lovely place for a picnic.

A summer walk. I've never really visited the park before, only to go to the zoo, I was a bit disappointed with it if I'm honest. There is plenty of open space, some garden like features too but it seems to lack any warmth and beauty, it's way too impersonal. There are a couple of childrens playgrounds and a boating lake, but somehow, for me anyway, it still lacks any 'sparkle'.
Lovely Park. Regent's park, In my opinion is the nicest park in London, not to crowded and massive amounts of greenery. It also has the London zoo in it, a great place to go to if your a big Kid.

An oasis in the middle of London. Spent a morning walking around the British Museum and then Carnaby street, we walked back to Regent's Park for a bit of piece and quite, the gardens are so well kept, the lack of litter was great and we had lunch in the Smoke House Grill and BarWhat a great place in a fantastic City

Loved it. Walked from Baker Street Tube Station, 2 mins to the entrance of the park, then walked around Queen Mays garden, within the park, and then onto Primrose HILL, passing London Zoo. A nice walk on a sunny day in August, not too crowded. .
Relaxing Getaway. If you are looking for a little bit of peace in London, visit this wonderful park! I recommend hiring a pedalo to enjoy the views from an easy to pedal boat! Great fun for all ages!

An oasis in the middle of London. Visited in August and the park was so peaceful. Set well away from the bustle of Euston Road and Marylebone Road, this was a lovely place to relax. The gardens were immaculate.

Lovely warm friday morning. Had not been here for years and as it was good weather went on a fri morning . Lovely time not to crowded and lots to see . We spent a couple of hours here wandering round looking at plants and the water . Enjoyed .

My favorite. Each time I stay at London I try to take some time to walk through this park. Lovely flower arrangements made with ambition, very pretty Queen Mary's Rose Garden, so many kinds of Roses..

Beautiful park on a lovely summers day!. Had a pleasure of enjoying this beautiful park on a lovely warm Saturday in August.It is a beautiful park and enjoyed a picnic while watching the world pass me by. It is such a relaxing space where it was great to escape from the hussle of bussle of central London.There are plenty of cafes and ice cream parlours if needed and of course London zoo is within the park although we didn't visit it this time!

Friday night open air theatre. What an amazing and wonderful treat, with a wonderful show of Jesus Christ Superstar in the beautiful setting of the open air theatre in this wonderful London park. The park itself is so beautiful, we had a really good burger in the park cafe before going to watch this incredible production on a warm and balmy night, with fireflies in the dark night air, making this the best and most magical of evenings.
Lovely Walk. Had a lovely walk from London Zoo down to Trafalger Square area. Areas clearly marked for cyclists, areas for sports and beautifully kept trees and plants to compliment your walk.

Sunny day. I spent half a day in that wonderful park. It was a very hot day and the park was full of families, children and tourists like me. I strolled with my friends through the beautiful gardens, walked by the lake, taking nice photos and having good time!.
stunning. relax on a summer lunchtime with friendswalk in the rain dodging squirrels in autumngo for brisk walks in wintermarvel at the variety of colours in springjust the best park in london

Great place. I just love this park in the centre of London, from the beautiful flowers to the amazing and well-kept grounds. Just walking around and enjoying the scenery can keep you entertained for hours.

lovely well kept park worth a stroll or jog through. i visited the park one morning i was delighted to see the baby ducks and sat and watched them for a while the park is huge but i enjoyed the tranquility and lovely greenery worth a visit

Beatifulpark in central London. Perfect for a picnic, reading good book, going to the theatre, strolling through the gardens admiring the flowers, finding the little twists in turns along the canal. Favourite park in London

I loved it so much I returned and returned. The beauty is breathtaking due to the colours of the trees. Unbelievable rose bushes and they give the names of the roses as well. A visit to London would be incomplete unless you visit this incredible park.

real evasion in the center of London. Wonderful park just to stay and be a real londonian, enjoying big green spaces to seat.
A real "poumon vert" in the heart of london, just near the station of Saint-Pancras international. A good area to stay tanning during a couple of hours.

Best park in London. I really love this park, its where i use to come as a young child and still now nearly in my 30's can spend a whole day here just relaxing and getting away from all the hustle and bustle of central. In the summer everything looks amazing the waterfalls to the clean cut grass and flowers. This park has always been looked after and very clean. Its a family/friends or couples friendly place with everyone minding they own business, The boating lake is a good spot and busy and also the gardens are nice, tennis court available or just kicking about a football on the field is good as. My all time favourite park.
This is a really interesting park with history and current activities. This is an interesting park with a range of activities happening. We went through it as part of a larger tour.
Wonderful gardens. We enjoyed a brisk walk around the outside of the park. A great variety of gardens and open fields to enjoy.
Extensive! Classy!. Huge park! Plenty of play area for the kids. Nice cafe for snacks and cheeky Pimm's in the Park :)And the Rose garden is magic!

A wonderful Royal Park. This place is lovely at the moment as it allows you to get some shade and see some great flower displays. There is plenty of space for kids to play and you can hire a boat on the lake or the kids can have their own on the small pond. There are a few places to eat which are good but expensive so probably best to get a takeaway snack and have it as a picnic. There is a secret garden to find and the rose garden and formal beds near Regent's Park tube are great too. There is also an open air theatre which is nice on a warm night.

Sanctuary if you want some time out.. I love this place. There are separate areas where you can find a seat to watch the world go by or to find a peaceful spot to read. Magnificant garden displays that make you want to replicate in your own garden ( will never happen), thoughtfully placed statues and fountains and the long concourse lined by majestic trees. Queen Mary's Garden within the park is full of birds and flowers. London Zoo also to be found within the park.Small cafe's near gates for basic drinks but take some change (25p) for amenities.Take a picnicEasy to get to as short walk from several tube stations nearby
Am`zing Place to spend a quiet day. This must be one of the most beautiful public places in the London. The park is well tended and is very clean, with wide walk ways all throughout.

Wonderful Park. This park is fantastic, no matter how busy it is you can find your own space because it's so large. However the toilet facilities need to be better otherwise this park would definitely get full marks, hands down my favourite park in London.
Pristine. Very nice gardens, but a bit lacking in variety. Enough to attract a return visit during our stay, though.

Day out. Regent's Park is a beautiful place to go especially summer time
It has got cafe and public toilet , nice for children and family outing and famous London Zoo is close to go
lovely place to pass a few hours. went for a cup of tea and a relax , lovely surroundings a nice place for a walk . very clean and well kept

Beautiful,. We wandered around the park whilst waiting for the Open Air Theatre production of Jesus Christ Superstar and we were amazed at how peaceful and relaxing it was. The flower beds are stunning it was really hard to be,I've we were in the centre of London!

20 pence to spend a penny. Very few benches here unlike other London parks. I feel it is more a stroll through place rather than somewhere to stop off to relax or picnic, although there were lots of people enjoying the latter.
Great Park. Plenty of activities - loved the plants and roses. Plenty of open spaces - felt very relaxed. A great place for a picnic.
beautiful. beautiful nature, peaceful part of the city, lovely paths, most relaxing time to spend, London Zoo, playgrounds, lake
AMAZING PLEASE. One of the most fabulous parks, if you are visiting London for business or leisure ,and like to walk, this must be visited place
Lovely walk. My boyfriend and I walked through this park and it was lovely. Its well looked after and its clean. I would definitely go for a walk there again.
Best Gardens in London. Need to get into nature after a busy time in London! Take a half day here to run, play or have a picnic! What beautiful grounds!!

Lovely day out. I came with my husband on a really lovely day, the sun was shining and the sky was blue. We walked around the park and then went on the paddling boats. Really recommend you should do it as it makes it more enjoyable

Has the best gardens in London. Spent several days walking the gardens here at Regents Park. Lovely roses and ponds. Plenty of diversity. There is access to a floating restaurant and colleges from the gardens. Close to museums and shopping. The weather was perfect during our stay and we were able to picnic here regularly. Very romantic. The grounds were well cared for and you can tell. Loved it here.
Well kept and pretty. We went there to run off some of the energy of our small boy, and found out it is also a very nice and well kept park.

Jesus Christ Superstar!. What an amazing open air theatre! My annual birthday treat. Although it drizzled upon the four of us we had a tremendous experience in the lovely location & the theatre. Everything is extremely well organised from food, drinks to the toilet location & numbers to coping strategies with the rain on the stage. We thoroughly enjoyed the performance & although I wept for Jesus in the Getsemany gardens prior to his arrest we all agreed that Judas was outstanding & the High Priests were AWESOME! Excellent choreography.Expected Magdalen to be more charismatic/ powerful. Jesus with a roll up cigarette was "new in translation"!Many thanks. Brilliant show; superb park.
Way better than Hyde Park. I don't know why i enjoyed it more than Hyde Park, i loved watching the geese and pigeons everywhere, and this park has a quite eccentric vibe that i enjoyed

Amongst the Top 5 parks iv EVER seen!. This is a lovely park which is super well maintained and is surrounded by pretty looking neighborhoods. I went there biking (there is a Santander bike stand in the park). The rose garden is stunning and also the cute waterfalls and ponds. There are some interesting installations/ statues with creepers growing on them. U can see all kinds of birds and the vibe overall is very happy and pleasant.
Nice place for a walk. It's a beautiful park especially the part where the flower garden is. You also have the Zoo close by. Recommend it to everybody.

Great walk.. I had some time to kill and I was close by to regents park so decided I would go and have a walk, so glad I did.The views were beautiful and I found i8t nice a relaxing.It easy to get to and you can spend as long as you want here.
Lovely park. Large sprawling park somewhat between Picadilly Circus and Buckingham Palace. the 2nd time we went to London, there was a large bike race which was fun to see.

Wonderfully royal. A well-known park, smacked in the middle of London, between Camden and Lisson Grove. If you are around, grab lunch at a nearby supermarket and bring it here when the sun is out - one of the best London experiences you can have.

Lovely Day in Regents Park. A very extensive public park with lots of seating and an open air theatre. But a picnic on the grass surrounded by areas of attractive flowers and trees is an attractive proposition. Lots of people on the very pleasant day we visited - but there is so much space you can find a place of your own without much intrusion. A great London amenity.

Fabulous park. Decided to take the the dogs on a different walk away from my local area, so I started off at Camden Lock amongst the hustle and bustle of Camden and walked all way along towards Regent's canal, taking in the wonderful White Villas on the other side of the canal and the greenery as the path widens and quietens away from Camden. You really feel London life here and are reminded of what a great place it is to live. It does get busy but there it feels very cultural, walking past the markets, we stopped off at a little cafe right by St Mark's Church which was very peaceful and pretty. The dogs loved the walk and when we reached Regent's Park they were even happier. I'd only ever been to Regent's Park once before so had forgotten just how big it is. There is lots of open space for dogs to run around it. There was a cricket match on and lots of people playing football - a lovely sunny day and a good chance of experience North London. Only downside is it is obviously very touristy and we went on a Saturday so it was heaving with people along the canal spilling out from Camden.

Great park. I have been visiting Regents Park for many years. It never fails to be a great place to visit. It covers a large area. It stretches from Baker Street across to Camden Town.The gardens are kept full of flowers. There are plenty of quiet areas if you want to sit and read and plenty of areas full of people if you want to people watch. Lots of grass to sunbath or picnic on at no cost. There is an open air theatre and you can hire pedal boats to go round the lake. At the Camden Town end, near the zoo, there is a children's play area. Places to eat and drink are available. I find this a very relaxing place in the busy city. I highly recommend Regent's Park for a visit. Near tube stations and on bus routes so easy to get to.

Beautiful place to chill. I love going through Herron my way into work or on my way home. I always feel a bit calmer after passing through. There are so many special attractions, like the pagoda and the serpentine gallery.

Visit with the inlaws. I recently went to Regents Park for a day out with the in laws and my 2 month old baby. We had a lovely day out visiting the rose gardens and sitting by the lake. It's a lovely way to spend a sunny afternoon. Bring a picnic blanket and you could easily spend all day there. Highly recommended.

Picnic in the park. Had a lovely picnic in the park with my friends family. lots of space for the little boy to run around, enjoyed tea in the Garden 'Café and spent some time at the childrens play area.

Don't Miss It!. What's not to love about Regent's Park? It's huge, peaceful, attracts many different user groups so there can be fun activities to watch, you can go on a pretty big walk through it, it's next door to the Zoo, and there are lots of things to take pictures of.

To get out of the busy city life. This is my favorite park in London. It's not as crowded as others, and when you get inside you forget busy city life instantly. People do little picnics on grass and if it's a fine day you can see many Brit's sunbathing here. Tree's in this park are also fascinating. Ideal to meditate, read or have a little picnic with friends.
nice walk and a nice place. lovely park with great views can relax and walk around great atmosphere and feels like you are not in central london relaxing and worth a visit

Great park to stroll through!. Regent's park being a bit more out of the way than hyde park is much nicer.
In addition, it includes the London zoo, a great place to go to with kids!
Tip: Plan on having some coins if you want to go to toilets as they have automated "tolls".
Another lovely London Park. London has an abundance of pretty urban greenspaces and this is no exception. Well manicured lawns and beautiful greenery.
Best park in London. Best park in London, for walking, having a picnic or just to see the beautiful roses. Wonderful experience
Day in the park. Good place to lose a 1/2 day walking around the wonderful grounds a little boot trip if your up for it.

Playground/cafe left at end of ponds. There are several playgrounds here. But if coming from Baker Street as you enter turn left and keep going towards the end of the pond. Takes about 10 minutes. The cafe is nearby and the playground ha some tables for sitting and picnicing. Also some small pedal yellow boats you can hire for half hour or hour (pricey though)

Best place to get over jetlag. We arrived at 6am, after a 24 hour travel time. We were zonked.So, a day walking through the Regent's Park was brilliant. Such a beautiful relaxing place to acclimatise. The gardens are very very beautiful and there is so much quiet space. Hard to pick a favourite spot - it is all lovely.Was surprised though by the rule-bound service in the cafe. We wanted to order lunch at 11.50. Nope, lunch orders aren't taken until 12.00. Wasn't even able to order on the understanding that the food wouldn't be prepared until after 12.00 - had to wait and line up at the correct time. C'mon!!!

Massive park fantastic landscaped gardens you'll love it. Regent's park was not in our plans plus it was red hot, but after we had been up Primrose hill via Camden we enjoyed this walk back though the avenue gardens loved the stone fountains & flowers & roses, we planned to do the reverse walk on our next visit.

The place to spend a perfect London Sunny day. We had gone with friends on a beautiful Sunny Saturday afternoon. Its the best place to have a picnic, enjoy a few drinks and just relax! Had a great time

Smell the roses. This time of the season when roses are in bloom and attracting honey bees. Go and smell the roses - red ones being more fragrant - and check out the friendly squirrels out to feed from your hand. On the second Sunday at midday, check out the meeting of French Bulldogs.

Best park in London?. Smaller than Hyde Park but much nicer. Seems more tranquil and less noisy/chavvy
Nice rose garden and waterfall with some great walkways. Plenty of expanses of grass for people to lie in. A great place to go and relax away from the busy city
Walk in the park. Enjoyed a sunny summer evening. The park was full of people enjoying the garden and boating on the lake. You see pigeons, swans, ducks, crows and the tiny white water birds.

Awesome . So peaceful and great park..
The lake is adding more beauty to the park with the beautiful trees surrounding..
So magnificent and really you will enjoy each minute..
A great area to escape from the busy center of London..
Trip by the boat is so great idea..
Well laid out enjoyable park. I spent some time in the park before visiting the open air theatre. It has pleasant avenues and rose gardens with many interesting areas.

REGENT'S PARK. Regent's Park is the most beautiful park in London! You should visit it. So big and full of animals and activities to do: ducks, gooses, squirrels... you can play athletics, football, rugby, cricket, volleyball... There is a lake inside called the "Boating Lake" where you can rent a pedalo boat or a simple boat (prices are child 7£ and adult 10£). It is the perfect place for a sunny day!

Just beautiful!. We fell across this by accident but it is huge! What a lovely place to explore, there is a little theatre as well, beautiful gardens, flowers even a boat lake. Very family friendly and certainly recommended for a lovely wander round.
Huge an beautiful.. An oasis in the middle of city. A very relaxing place. Ver weel maintained. Recommend the café in the middle of the park. Good food.
Beautiful. Another one of London's brilliant parks to walk around, Perfect in the early morning sunshine or a stroll in the evening as the suns setting. Beautiful place.

Best place to catch Pokemon in Central London. A wide range of Pokemons appear in Regents park and their population seems to be very dense.The park itself is very nice with a bit of everything - sport pitches, grassy fields, gardens, ponds, and etc.The only downside is that getting there/coming back home before/after intensive workout can be quite bothersome, depending on which part of the park you go to - the park is really big. I wish they had a bus/tube stop right in the middle of the park.

My favourite park in London. I do live close by so I may be biased, but this is a wonderful park. The playing fields are great to watch some games going on, or hang out with a large group of friends. The rose garden is beautiful with fountains, but what I like most is the hidden garden - I won't say where exactly it is, but when you find it you will realise why it is so special...Also, the theatre is excellent - a beautiful setting!

Great for a Run!. My husband and I ran five kilometers in Regent's Park one evening during our trip. The rose garden was my favorite part, followed by Primrose Hill (technically just outside Regent's Park). We had a great time here, although we both thought Hyde Park was better for a run because the sights are more evenly distributed for the runner's enjoyment.
Peacefull Except Near th Sports Area. Nice place to get away from the city, very nice and peaceful and very beautiful especially on a fine day. On a fine day also very nice down by the Canal
Beautiful place for a quiet walk. Enjoyed wandering along many paths through lovely gardens, hidden ponds, huge trees, etc on my way to Regents Canal.
Very beautiful park. Regent´s Park - as all parks in London - is very beautiful. And it´s big, too. The Zoo is situated in the park, so it´s great for a Family day out. Kids will enjoy it!

Fun Place to Hang Out with the Locals. We enjoyed a picnic afternoon watching cricket and enjoying the expansive walks. There is a lot to see and places to grab a snack or a drink. Many cool little corners and spots to put down a blanket and just relax.
Staff picnic. This is a lovely place. Beautifully green, plenty of space, super gardens and plenty of room for every one. We had a picnic and an energetic rounders match. A great green space

Beautiful gardens with lots to do. Great place to escape the noise and hectic pace of London. It is a quiet park ideal for a walk, whether through the formal English gardens which are beautiful or the other well kept parkland. The boating lake can amuse you and there is plenty of space to have your own picnic which was great on the sunny day we were there. Many other people also were out walking their dogs or playing games with their kids. If you like wildlife there are many wildfowl to observe and also enjoy.
Girgeous. Loved this place could spend my life here. Great cafe there with amazingly friendly manager. I really can't explain how lovely this place is a MUST GO SEE
beautiful as ever!. Walking in this stunning garden takes you back to when you were young. Nothing has changed and the flowers are scented and lovely with a sense of peace when you are in the area.

Very pleasant❣ . Very pleasant place to visit. You can enjoy flowers garden,full of wonderful roses. You can also enjoy boating. I went there several times with my family and would love to visit it again.
Nice and cozy place for a walk. A green island in the central part of London. A lot of birds. Especially nice dancing squirrels which on their hind paws asks for food

Amazing park!. The place to be for a nice walk or a little rest on the grass.
Also the place to think about philosophical questions or more fun and light conversations.
The gardens are also very nice to walk through.
Another awesome park. If you thought Hyde park was huge, the Regent's park is no less. Please do visit it if you have ample amount of time.
Stroll through the park . A beautiful open space so much to take in .... Park beautifully maintained ... Lovely lake and lots of wildlife to spot along the way

An enchanted park you'll love!. I love the outdoors, and every time I have the chance, I love spending time in nature. This metropolitan park is an amazing place! It's enormous, wide, with lots of animals every where: they come close as you walk or as you sit down for a pic nic or a rest.The lake is peaceful and beautiful. Please, come here for a relaxing afternoon, to regenrate your energies after long walks across London's touristic places. This spot is full of beauty: the beauty of nature!

Delightful. Had a wander through recently, weather was spectacular, park was full of people enjoying themselves. Picnics a plenty, cyclists having a ride. People playing with Frisbee s, dogs, balls lots of different things.fab atmosphere. Lots of chatter. No sign of any trouble. No litter. It was an absolute pleasure, a great way to while away some time.

Beautiful place for a walk. We caught the tube here and then walked and walked.Thoroughly enjoyed it. Loved people watching as we meandered through the park.Eventually passed by London Zoo and walked to Camden Lock and along the canal.Very enjoyable and plenty of seats and shade if it's sunny.

Fabulous park!!. This is just a fabulous park if you love flowers, plants, architecture! It is so peaceful! But don't go on Sunday afternoon on a sunny day or it will be less quiet! Still, it is a place to vite while in London!

A very nice example of splendid english garden. After having visited dozens of parks in London, I continue to think that Regent's Park contains the greatest diversity of what you want to see in an english garden: magnificent flowers paths, fountains, lakes, longchairs, places to play sports, bridges, wild animals.
Nice walk. This is one of the better walks around London. Well worth the getting there. Plenty of shade even on a bright sunny day.
Stunning . Visited this park for the first time yesterday. It was absolutely stunning with lots to see! Would highly recommend for a beautiful walk or a picnic.
Super place for a stroll/relax. Very large central London park, great place to stroll and relax or to take exercise. Many places to eat and drink. The park Londoners choose to sunbathe and relax in.

A bowl of fresh air!. Regent's Park is a vast area full of trees, shrubs and lawns combined with fountains making it ideal for a welcome stroll. The only problem is that being in London several hundred people will be strolling along with you.
Nice place. Very nice , clean green space in London to visit. Beautiful area to visit and forget you are in a big city
Glorious walk. Always visit the royal parks . . .they make the day better. Glorious people watching, sights, and sun. The Queen's Rose Garden is a must.
Great Park. One of the main parks in London. You cannot miss it if you visit Buckingham Palace. Great for walkers and you can even have a picnic.
Regents Park is a bit more magic in London. This very large park has it all. Sports fields, chilling area to just park off and an excellent rose garden. Prepare to walk for hours!

Since I live here, I May well be biased... This place is one of the loveliest parts of London. Take your time and explore, from the rose garden to the historical statues to the squirrels climbing up trees and eating pigeons, a wonderful place in the summertime, and much like Russia in the winter, not so good in the snow

Spacious and quiet yet fun. Walking through this park to reach the London zoo, we learned quite spacious and quiet yet providing fun places for people.Once being in the park, we didn't hear any car noise and since London didn't have many high rise buildings, we could enjoy the great nature oriented skyline.People seemed to have great time for picnic, sunbathing, playing succor, baseball or cricket.There're lots of big parks in metropolitans and we also have visited many parks across the world, but we felt this was one of most pleasant, spacious (by feel) parks.

Beautiful stroll through gardens and greens. Incredible flowers. Although, I am told, that the roses are best in June, our July visit was lovely. Put on a good pair of walking shoes as you'll want to spend a lot of time exploring this incredible park. Between the plantings and the flowers and the walkways and the ponds, there are delights around every corner. We saw quite a number of different ducks, herons, and so on. Be sure to bring bottled water if it's a warm day and you expect to be there for some time. (Primrose Hill isn't far away so be sure to include that on your tour.)

Right in the middle of London. Great park with plenty of things to see and do! Play area for children, a rose garden, a lake, a cafe and even a zoo. We had a lovely, relaxing day away from busy central London! Going back next week with my 2 young children to visit the zoo:-)
My friends the squirrels. Clean park, large, with a lot of adorable squirrels who come to you to say a little hello, I really liked this place during my stay in London

Peaceful Oasis. We spent and hour or two wandering the paths and admiring the well kept gardens while we warded off the jet lag and waited for our hotel check in time. Had purchased sandwiches on the way and enjoyed then while sitting on a park bench beside the lake. It was a beautiful, sunny day with the birds singing and the roses just coming into bloom in Queen Mary's garden. A blissful start to our holiday.

A gem in the middle of London. Walk through Queen Mary's Garden and enjoy a stroll near the lakes, you'll find herons, ducks, bird, swans, squirrels and more wildlife.Then head towards Primrose Hill and enjoy the view..

In the rain. Even when it is raining cats and dogs this place is still worth going to.I couldn't believe the variety of birds that I spotted. It's huge so be warned...my legs ached once I travelled from one end to the other. There is a boating area on the lake and good information boards on all the entrances.

Lovely park. We wandered through on way to Madame Tussards and stopped for a picnic. Lovely park with a large lake where you could hire boats for adults and children. Lots of ducks, swans and geese.Could easily spend some time there

beautiful park. I love regents park. Great for a picnic in a park up London. The park is massive and has really beautiful settings great for taking photos of flower etc the lake is pretty and also London zoo is housed in the park. Great day out for families and friends to just relax and watch people pass by.

Beautiful!. Our hotel was located right next to Regent's Park. We had a lunch picnic on a bench and went for jogging in the morning. It is a beautiful park that deserves a visit. It was very calm on Sunday morning with the occasional jogger. There are some locations where you can enjoy a coffee. Very nice flowers.
Very nice park. This is one of London's many very nice parks. Be sure to check out all their parks during your visit.

Regents Park. This is a lovely park that is a nice walk. The London Zoo is just outside of the park and is also a must see. Their is a boardwalk so lots of room to walk down the mainway or you can venture off into the side walks.

A Walk in the Park. I decided to be adventurous and walk to a museum and passed through Regent's Park. I found that there was a lot of beautiful scenery and ended up at Queen Mary's Garden where I also enjoyed some breakfast. The park is huge and if you are looking for somewhere to be active while on vacation still, this is a great option because the park is so large. Definitely recommend.

It is a park as it has to be. That is a beautiful and accessible leisure park. You can walk, you can run, you can even get some sleep on the grass if it has not rain the day before. You will find nice flowers and people very happy with the summer. Very well cared public gardens and immense places to have a walk. Get your best snickers and go exercise out there.
Unusual Landscaping. An incredible area of green and respite in central London. In case you didn't know it is featured in Colin Firth's King's Speech.

A huge park with gardens within.. A huge park with lots of useful, well placed maps to help you find your way around! We wanted a café and there was even a choice. You can rent paddle boats on the lake and deck chairs on the grass should you want to. Lots of places to have your own picnic too. The landscaped gardens are very pretty too.

Beautiful and extremely well maintained royal park. This big royal park is beautiful and extremely well maintained. You can find there vast green areas as well as big selection of flowers and especially roses. There is also a small river and pond where ducks and some other animals can be found. The cafeteria in the inner circle is spacious and offers a wide selection of salty and sweet pastries.

Jesus Christ Superstar . Regents Park Open Air TheatreA few days ago I was invited to see a new production of "Jesus Christ Superstar " I have seen this musical many times since it first opened in London in the 70sI have to say this was one of the best - unmissable!!!Apart from enjoying a barmy evening in one of the best parks in London

My favourite park in London. Regents Park is such a beautiful park. So many flowers to see and always change according to the seasons. So many different routes to walk. One of my favourites is to walk around the lake and then walk through Avenue Gardens and come back through Queen Mary's Gardens and view the Secret Garden - which is my favourite.

beautiful. When you walk round Regent's Park you forget everything, your mind becomes clear and you are so memorised by the views that you wouldn't realise you were walking round a park in the UK. This is a cut through to London Zoo which is much nicer way then taking the bus, it is about a 20 minute walk to the zoo from the south entrance so it isn't in fact too far. The park is so well maintained and you can tell that people really take pride in their work there. There are benches all around so if you want to just sit down and take it all in you can, there are also cafes and restaurant on the way so if you get peckish you can stop off for a bit to eat and there are loos which is also important, although you do have to have to pay 20p. All together this is a very magical park and you really need to walk round it when in London as it is breathtakingly beautiful.

Gorgeous park and lovely cafe. This park is stunning all year round. We visited it as we saw Jesus Christ Superstar at the Open Air Theatre and ate lunch in the cafe next to it and Queen Mary's Rose Garden.The food in the cafe was delicious. There was a substantial hot menu - the fish and chips and steak sandwich winning the family votes as best meals - and a "grab & go" area for fruit, cake, tea, coffee and baguettes. All fresh food and tasty. Average price for a hot main meal is £12.00. It was extremely busy but service was fast. There are lots of tables inside and outside the cafe.
Great place for all family members. Amazing park and served very well by cafes, food and toilets. We enjoyed the paddle boating and the everywhere flowers!
Relaxing. Relaxing, peaceful, beautiful place to sit and have a picnic or just enjoy strolling in this remarkable park
Beautiful Park in the Summer. I came here on a beautiful summer day. It was well maintained, blooming flowers everywhere. May be crowded on a good day; people are sunbathing!

The best park in London. It is a park in a very nice area in London. It is huge and you can walk for hours seeing different places. Green open places for pic nick, lakes,rivers, gardens full of flowers, coffee shops etc. Although it has a lot of visitors it is peaceful. If you visit London I think that it is the first park that you must visit.
Best day ever with the family. the garden was fabulous and we enjoyed our visit the weather was great and view was remarkable will definitely visit again

Amazingly Beautiful Park. Must visit :). This park is very beautiful and very well maintained. Flowers are arranged magnificently and the garden is just stunning. Great park for hanging out and walking trails. Queen Mary's Garden specially is very nice when roses are blossoming so make sure to visit in season. Lots for photographers too. Highly recommend. Must visit. Its free too.

No.1 free thing to do in London. If you have a spare 4-6 hours then you can start at Canary Wharf and walk all the way to Little Venice and what a walk it is!!The earlier that you start the better because the walk is flooded with cyclists and runners. But there is room for all.From Canary Wharf to Kings Cross it's a fascinating look at the old and the re-developed sitting side-by-side. But if you don't want to walk the whole thing then you must pick the canal up at Kings Cross and head north. Some sensational new developments to marvel at and dream about living in. Then you hit Camden Lock. Not my favourite but an incredible array of stalls and eating places. Continuing on, you walk through beautiful houses up to Regents Park and then you reach London Zoo (you can't miss the Aviary). At this point you can continue on to Little Venice but I would suggest that you dive off right onto Primrose Hill for the best free view of London landmarks. From there it's a short walk to Hampstead Heath and another sensational London attraction.You've got to do it. You will learn more about London in a day than you will get from any book or organised trip.And it's free!!!

I loved this park best of all of them in London. It is located NW of the city center but it is easy to get to on the tube. I love roses and the Queen Mary's Rose Garden is amazing, better than the large Rose Garden in Portland,OR or any other Rose Garden in the USA.
best park in London. I particularly like the north of the park because you can see a lot of the animals from the Zoo for free
Beautiful park. Love this park, is beautiful in any time of the year, but the best is when the roses are in bloom, in summer you can take a boat on the lake, nice place to relax :)
Love it. Absolutely loved the park, went with my little boy & husband, enjoyed the queen Mary's garden the most. Brilliant place to walk about with the family
Great walk. If you want to go for a walk, run or just do something during your spare time, this is the right place for you.

Holiday. It's a very nice park , with a lot of coloured flowers. The pedal boats are also very nice and the cost of one ride is really good. It costs a family of four £28 for an hour . It's an exceptional place to go for a walk , the fountain is very nice and there are a lot of chairs to sit on .

Perfect for sunny day in London . This park is massive so be prepared to walk a lot. Get your most comfortable shoes on and enjoy everything what this park has to offer. Beautiful colourful flowers, many hidden fountains, and easy access to London Zoo is just couple attractions. You will love it!
Beautiful park. This park boasts some real horitcultural ingenuity, flowers are arrange magnificently and the garden is just stunning.

Lovely flowers. We visited only a small section of this great park but it was wonderfull. Our main Place was the playgound and the kids loved it. We also walked in the flower gardens near the playground an they were absolutely wonderfull! The park was clean and well kept. Would be a nice place for a picnic.
Always a queue for everything. And a slow queue at that. . Ok for just a walk I guess, if you don't mind crowds, but Soviet style level of service at boating and cafe. No shade. Avoid.
Gorgeous. it is a very quite place, with beautifull plants, flowers. It is also very clean and it is a good spot to have a rest.

Just loverly. Very pretty and well maintained. Right in the middle of everything but large enough to feel away from the cars and the city. Landscaping, roses and flower beds are far above average. So is the people watching. A great way to spend the first day when flying in and trying to adjust to the jet lag

Nice city park. This made for a lovely evening walk on a hot day as we were waiting to meet a friend for dinner in the area. I wouldn't go out of your way to see this park, but if you do visit, make sure to see the rose garden.

Beautiful . We came here for an event with work it was the hottest day of this year and it was beautiful, so much lovely scenery to take in, friends reliable grounds staff who are happy to help or direct you, drinks and toilets available. I would recommend this park to anyone visiting Camden.

Beautiful!. Great park for hanging out and walking trails. The gardens and ponds are very well maintained and provide a beautiful atmosphere. Definitely choose Regent's Park over Hyde Park if your looking for an option.

Very good place to relax. A great alternative to Hyde Park as it does not get as busy. The scenery is also much prettier. There's a mall with shaded trees but the highlight of the park in my opinion is the rose garden. There are hundreds of varieties and you could get overwhelmed just smelling them all. But it's very nice. Very calming. Also when you are finished, you can visit Baker Street whopich has the fictitious address of Sherlock Holmes. Garden A+

A Fun Run & Pleasant Stroll. If you're seeking out running trails while on vacation Regent's Park has easy to difficult paths of varying lengths. The paths provide an overview of the park: water features, boating options, children's activities, and people watching. We ran 2 trails and the only downside is that you have to follow the maps in the park - there's no app for your phone. Regent's Park isn't huge, but it has fun activities for kids and adults and several running/walking paths that make for a nice exercise/recreational afternoon.

Great greenery just outside of touristy craze area. One of our favourite places in London for a walk / picnic or a game of sports. Queen Mary's Garden are esp nice when rose are blossoming so make sure to visit in season.

Beautiful Park - Runners Paradise !. I stayed in Regents park area recently for a work trip to London. Being a keen runner I set about on the Monday evening to check my surroundings for running routes. I took a stroll through regents park on a late evening after work as it was getting dusky. It was one of the hottest days of the year and even though it was late there were still lots of people about on the grass enjoying a champagne picnic, runners taking advantage of the slighter cooler temperature or people taking a stroll. It's such a pretty park. Very flat. Big wide paths so no problem for pedestrians, runners & cyclists. Very very clean. No litter anywhere. A very quaint little coffee shop & there are a few snack stops and cafes dotted along the way. It's very close to London Zoo. Beautiful gardens there. It's a huge park and I didn't get the opportunity to go around all of it but so much there and gorgeous green open space. In my 1 overnight stay in London I visited regents park 3 times! So that speaks volumes in how much I loved it. I went back the very following morning to run through it & up to Primrose Hill. (Just the other side of regents park) I highly recommend you take the stroll (or run/bike) up there it's only about a mile and you get stunning views across the whole of London. I was in awe at sunrise and it definitely made the run to the top very worth while. I then returned again to steal 30 mins in the sunshine on my lunch break the same day as it was just a 5 minute walk from Triton Street & found I was joining 100s of other commuters and city workers with the same thought - but it was lovely. Still very easy to find a spot on the grass to enjoy my lunch, the park & the sunshine. It's an affluent area of London. Big houses, posh cars - nice to drift off into a dream world for a few minutes whilst there.I must say I felt very safe. As a female on my own I was cautious of course as you should be where ever you are, but there was always lots of people about, plenty of runners & bikes.If you are in fitzrovia district or near regents park - give it a go. You won't be disappointed.

So much to see. I only had 30 minutes to visit and barely touched the park. It is so large and beautiful. I will go back and spend a few hours there one day. There are paddle boats in the pond, animals all over the place, and very scenic vistas. You don't even realize you're in the middle of a major city once you enter the gates.
Beautiful Park. This park was beyond beautiful. the park was clean and we were lucky to have a beautiful day as well. We brought snacks with us and sat out on the lawn and enjoyed the day.

Open space. We wandered across Regent's Park whilst exploring London. As it was a Saturday, there were a lot of people enjoying playing various sports, as well as a number of dog walkers and other tourists. It was great to get away from the traffic for a while.
beautiful Park. The London Zoo is very close and you can make a great day by visiting the regents park. Good or a family PicNic.
Spectacular park. A wonderful park with swans, ponds, fantastic gardens, and more. Everyone in our family, including our 11 and 18 year olds, and their parents, loved this park.
Walks and teas. Love Regent Park more than any other. It has some super walks, clean and tidy and pleasant to see. You can stop for tea and refreshments, cakes etc.
Peaceful oasis. One of the highlights of the whole trip - walking through Regent's Park on a quiet morning is an incredibly relaxing experience
My favorite. The most lovely park in London to my point of view, with a pond, beautiful flowers and so may lanes to get lost in...

Peaceful and relaxing. Great for walks, relaxation, family or friends day out and picnic. Queen Mary's Rose Garden very colourful, beautifully set, maintained and organised. Easy to get to and accessible with the tube or by car.

Best park in London. This park is overshadowed by Hyde park and St James but it is absolutely incredible, wildlife great, water features amazing and the rose garden and other flower beds immaculately kept. Loved Queen Marys garden. Quiet and peaceful with areas set aside for the sporting community
Beautiful gardens. Roses were in full bloom! Good walking paths thru gardens. Went to outdoor theater to see Henry V on sunny day. Great theater in garden

Relaxing!. Visited here on my lunch break! The park was really big! Lot's of benches for people to sit down. The path was wide! Soo.. cycles and jogging people and people casually walking can all be on the same path [without making room for people.It was sooo nice!! When the weather is warm and summery! A nice luxury walk around the park and eating lunch on the bench is amazing!

A walk in the park? - Amazing view :). Met up with a friend and instead of doing dinner we decided to go for a walk around Baker Street and we ended up in Regents Park. They have some amazing roses and loads of benches that you can sit on and enjoy the scenery. There's a spot with a waterfalls that reminds me so much of Dunn's River Falls in Jamaica.
Nuff Deer. A big further out but lovely place for a sunshine stroll/cycle. As the title states, there were nuff deer.

Summer walk : go and see Roses ! Amazing. Just walk from Little Venice to Regents Park.Personally I discovered only the flowers, despite a zoo and a theater to visit.The roses...around 400 different variety.A Royal place for a Royal walk: just have a break here during Summer. 100% success.

Head here if city crowds are getting you down. Open spaces, beautiful flowers, and tasty ice-creams abound in this park. Don't overfeed the geese and take a few pence for the loo for a getaway in the city.

Don't miss the ornate English avenues. Pride and Prejudice in the flesh.. This is a widely varied park with beautiful classical borders, wide rustic avenues, sports fields (nice for a few overs of cricket), wildlife refuges and wilderness areas given over to wild flowers and butterflies. A peaceful place for a stroll away from the madding crowds of Oxford Street.
Park walks. Beautiful green area with a lot of trees middle of London, the right size to walk round a round, you can come there very easy

Oasis in the city. After some intense houres at Madame Tussauds, we went for a nice and relaxing lunch i Regent's Park- just a few minutes walk away. There are sun chairs for hire and at the restaurant you can buy a picknick bag! Lovely place! Bring some peanuts for the squirrels or bread for the ducks- the children will have a good time feeding them.
Fantastic Park. Love London gardens and parks,the grass and hedges are so well maintained and the flowers are gorgeous.it is a pleasure to walk through these gardens.

Close to Camden. If you go to Camden, Euston or anywhere in the vicinity visit Regent's Park. On the baker logo line close to the Euston road and Madame tausards and don't forget London zoo is in the park
Quiet spot in a busy city. Was at Camden town market and wanted to get to Baker street - so walked through the park - very large park - busy on a Sunday.

A stunning park. This is one of London's stunning royal parks and definitely has a beautiful variety of greenery. It is also the home of the Open Air Theatre during Summer and London Zoo. Definitely worth a visit.
Beautiful Park. We spent several hours in this park and loved it.The park was clean and safe and well maintained.This is a huge park and takes some time to get round but is well worth it.

My local park and I love it. It's so lovely to see all the different groups using the many different areas of the park at all times of day - from the young cricketers by the hub, to the impromptu very international football games, to the sunseekers, to the boaters, to the middle-eastern families gathering round in the evening by the rose garden, to the wide variety of European families strolling through. I love my park - it is full of wonder and never ceases to please.

Great park but too big!. It's a nice park with lots to do, for example the boating lake is very nice and I recommend you try it with the padel boat. But the walking path next to the lake is full of birds and you have to watch your steps all the time. There's also a good access to London Zoo. The Queen Mary's Gardens were also quite nice. But overall the park is way too big(at least for me) and you could get very bored and tired walking through it, since there's lots of empty grass fields. But maybe it doesn't feel that big, if you do a picnic in one of the fields.

Beutiful oasis. Spent the afternoon wandering Regent's Park. It is a Beutiful park, and immaculately cared for. It has many different areas, flower beds, wilder areas, wooded area, play areas for kids but the waterfowl wildlife is wonderful with many Beutiful types of geese, ducks, herons and more, all in close proximity. Worth a wander through or a great place to take kids of any age - plenty room for a football.

A large open space with much to offer. If you like flowers it's worth a visit. Make sure you don't miss Queen Mary's Garden. We saw the end of the delphiniums and lots of roses. Lots of open areas for children enjoy as well as the ducks and geese on the lake.

Beautiful spot for a stroll. When we came here it was actually quite rainy, but it didn't matter - that's how beautiful the park is. There are quite a few spots to stop and eat or grab a coffee. Plus plenty of maps to guide you around (it's quite large). Highly recommended while in London!

Lovely park. We did a few runs in and around this park for our marathon training. Lovely park. Used both inside the park and the Outer Circle as routes. Gorgeous houses to look at on the outer circle. Has London Zoo there too.
Roses!. Amazing rose collection! Lovely place for afternoon walks, photos. Kinda get the Alice in Wonderland feeling. On a beautiful sunny day with many colors and rose scents.

An Outstanding Natural Space in Central London.. I was fortunate to visit at a time when scores of varieties of spring/summer flowers were at their best for colours and blossoms. I spent a delightful and relaxing afternoon in the sunny park, amazed at the brilliant colours of the flowers, the high quality of the maintenance of the grounds, the beautiful fountains and the wildlife that abounded in and around the ponds and lakes. A great place for individuals and families of all ages to come and enjoy nature, to take a break from the fast pace of the city. The park also contains a small number of high-quality restaurants that offer food and beverages at reasonable prices. Highly recommended.

Chill spot. This great park near Paddington is really beautiful, and full of people! It offers loads of spots to lay down with friends, partners, lovers, solo.... and enjoy the exceptional British summer when it is hot and sunny outside (yes it can happen)! Some of the gardens inside are splendid, offering various kinds of beautiful flowers. The park is also host to the world famous London Zoo!

Regents Park. It was a beautiful sunny afternoon, and we found this Parkland just amazing! The various coloured plants grouped together, beautiful displays of flowers and foliage, lake to view while enjoying a coffee....awesome!
watching the locals. loved walking here in Decembertook a train trip and hopped on and off all dayi could sit on a bench and watch the local people all day

What a beautiful place . This park is one of best and related place i visit this year
Kids have good time in London zoo and we enjoy the afternoon tea in the park and the amazing lake with dukes and birds
Roses, roses, roses. I always like visiting Regent's part in summer. The park looks just amazing as the roses and all other flowers blossom. I really like that the park is cared after.

Perfect Place to Walk and Relax. I always love to walk in the city park. Every city I visited for the first time I always put the city park on my priority list. This is one of the best parks in London beside Hyde park and St. James Park. Locoted on the north side of London downtown, and just near by Madame Tussauds Wax Museum. The park was well maintained and very clean. Plenty of trees, flows, bushes, and animals. This park is also the house of London Zoo.
Impressive park. One of the finest parks you can visit in London and in my opinion it is one of the best in the world for a relaxing time.

Varied. Regent Park is split into distinct areas. The central area within the circle road is landscaped with a number of paths. It is also the busiest area and lots of people come out for lunch and sit chilling on the grass.There is also the lake area with swans, ducks, etc and a band stand.
