I Love Regents park!. Regents park is amazing. We had a lovely stroll through the park on our way to and back from London Zoo and its so nice, tidy and clean! Would love to go back next time.

Another quiet place in the big city. Parks in London are something extraordinary and yet something very simple. There are so many of them that you cannot just escape .. but .. why would you do that ? ;). Regent's Park is very quiet. Lots of families with kids talking a walk, feeding birds ... There are lots of benches so if it's not cold you can just sit there with a book or a cup of coffee/tea and enjoy your day.
Huge. Spread over large area. Quiet interesting and good walk. Well decorated. Will be great in summer and fall season.

Best Park in London!. Don't miss this one!It's absolutely gorgeous, with different gardens, beautiful lakes, lovely bridges and birds all around. It's definitely the most beautiful park I went here in London.It's huge, so if you are really into parks reserve a few hours to see it, otherwise make sure to plan the areas you want visit before going so that you can enjoy properly.
Relax. sitting and walking in this park is just relaxing, one of the best parks in London. Children will enjoy playing there.
Relaxing afternoon. Regent's Park is a fantastic place to spend the afternoon in the sunshine! The park is very large and close to tube stations so is very accessible.

wonderful place to reflect and visit with friends. We spent a chilly afternoon in the park, wandering through with old friends and their young children. It is beautifully laid out and maintained of course. Spring is just around the corner and the park is being readied. Near Baker Street tube and definitely worth a visit. There is also (at least one) a lunch spot to have light food and drink.
Nice stroll. Luckily the weather was sunny and dry. Nice stroll around the Park the local council need to sort out dog mess. Not good.

Captivatingly beautiful . My office is in Camden and often walk through Regent's Park early morning to get to work. It's so beautifully kept and covers such a wide area of London that on a nice day makes walking a much better alternative to public transport. Clears the head and sets me up for the day ahead. It's beautiful in both the snow and sun!
beautiful park. relaxing and beautiful park in Central London. good on nice days for a stroll and picnic. Wonderful playground for kids dedicated to the late princess Diana.
Beautiful and Very big. Very near to London Zoo, easily accessible through tube. This is very big and very beautiful. Kids will like it very much.
Stunning!. Another beautiful place to visit in London. Fabulous when it's sunshine here . Just extremely relaxing with wonderful views .

Lovely place to go on a sunny day. Went on a lovely sunny day. Walked from the gates in the inner circle up towards the theatre and then turned left towards the rose gardens and then out across the road towards the zoo. Along the broadwalk to the right past beautiful laid out plantings in readiness for summer and cyress trees towards the children's playground. It was a great way to indulge in one of London's great park and it only cost us an ice cream!

Wild open space in the heart of London. Regent's Park has its manicured rose gardens and ponds but I love it most for the large open fields that really give a feel of being in the middle of nowhere despite being in one of the busiest cities in the world.

On a budget nothing better than strolling on a sunny day in regents park. With the family we took a walk into regents park. We have not done this for a while and we really enjoyed just walking and taking in all the beautiful surroundings. The mansions that curve around the park a reminder for those lucky people who live there how lucky they are to have such a park on there footstep. We strolled around the park going past the boathouse, the café was open , however the boat rides that I was hoping to surprise the kids with were not happening until winter season was over , these will begin from March onwards. To go the park cost nothing, take a hamper choose a nice day and relax, cant wait till the weather warms up to do this.

Day out. I am a keen photographer and,enjoy taking pic,tires o locations featured. This park is not only steeped in history,it has an array of sculptures and,superb areas that make for excellent,images.
familiar and beautiful. lovely to stroll in this park, and there are frequent cafes to idle the time drinking coffee or eating while reading - my favorite pastime

Beautiful, vast, relaxing park juxtaposed with the chaotic city!. Regent's Park is a wonderful place to get a good dose of nature within the city of London. There's a great network of paths for your leisure among fellow visitors, which includes walkers, runners, and their dogs!
The best park I have ever visited.. I cannot forget this gorgeous place! So beautiful and pieceful and so quiet! All views still before my eyes. Unforgettable impression.

Loved it.. We loved it. Children played in the play park which had a range of equipment for little kids as well as teen-aged. I liked the fact that the loos were children only and there seemed to always be a park keeper nearby to enforce this.Next time we come here we will pay to go to London Zoo which is incorporated into a corner of the park but has it's own parking etc.

Spectacular. I strongly recommend visiting Regent's Park. It has such an impressive range of gardens with sightly plants and pieces of ornamental architecture. The lakes are also exceedingly pleasant.

Wonderful Park. I have been there a lot of times. The most greatest Park I have ever seen. Park is so huge, there are lot of sport activities and brilliant nature. If you want to go a park in London I can recommend you this park absolutely.

Some beautiful areas to discover. Beautiful gardens to discover to the east and centre of the park, and gives the opportunity to enjoy a nice long walk in the middle of town. Camden market and London zoo are within walking distance.
Great park!. regent's park is very nice and hosts lots of events as well.Ideal for a sunday out with family and friends

Primrose Hill is always a winner.. I'm not sure I like informing tourists of the hang out that is Primrose Hill but it would be a shame for people to miss it. I take friends and family here if they've not really visited London so much before. Good view of London, community feel (New Year's Eve here is mental). Great park for running, and the outer circle is busy with cyclists. Nice architecture to look at on the way there. Camden is very close (walk down Parkway from Camden Town). The zoo is here so do it all... then walk to Baker Street and in to Marylebone. Good day out!
Beautiful and Serene. Love most of the parks in London but this one is my favourite. Gorgeous lawns and manicured gardens. Very peaceful and beautiful. Bring a book and relax.

Ducks all around in a beautiful park. Starting from the 'top' of the par, by the zoo and Primrose hill, it is quite a walk through the sports fields to get to the actual decorated part of the park. But once you get there, it is beautiful and very diverse. As you cross the bridges, notice the different kinds of ducks enjoying the peace on small islands in the river.
Nice place for a walk. Take a long walk through the park when the weather permits, and stop at the zoo while you're at it. Nice pond.

Lovely to fistic in the summer. This is the best park in London by a mile go in the summer and to to the inner circle by the collage Beautiful one garden best kept park in London lots for the kids to do toilets and cafe in park ,short walk to the zoo
Giraffes. A must-stop bonus when visiting Regent's Park is visiting the London Zoo Giraffe paddock on the North-end. It is right outside the park on the road, no need to enter the zoo!

Lovely!. After visiting all the amazing sites in London you must spend a bit of time enjoying this lovely park. It is such a break from the noise and chaos of downtown London. Cafes within the park are worth a stop. Enjoy and smell the roses!
If the weather is good, go. This is worth a visit any time of year to track the progress of the seasons. People watchers will love it. Nice cafés along the way.

Lovely park with a lot of wide open spaces. This is a nice park to walk through on a sunny day. There is always plenty going on and a lot of open space to just sit and relax. I usually walk the park in a square starting at Euston Road, along and round to the Zoo and back down again. It's a few miles walk but worth it.

Excellent park. This is an excellent park. It has the London Zoo within it and I love the canal walk from Camden Lock Market to it.Lots of joggers, lots of dog walkers, but plenty of space for everyone.
nice and friendly. the park itself is nice to walk in/ Tje market is nice/ we enfoyed walking through it, seeing all the people and nice small stores
Race for life event. I was a Marshall at this event, so i got to spend the day in this park and I only managed a quarter of the way you need at least 2 full days to get around this beautiful park.

Love the colours! <3. I absolutely love this park! It is just so beautiful and peaceful at the same time! The walk is amazing, the chirping of the birds, the squirrels running around! It's just so pleasant! There are beautiful flowers, trees, fountains, food places! Pets, kids, adults, I think everyone loves this place. There's a different colour everywhere you look and coming here makes you realize how many shades of the same colour there can be! Absolutely beautiful!

Excellent rose garden. One of the beautiful garden of the London and it is close to center. There are small lakes, rose gardens, cafes and beautiful flower beds... you should visit in Autumn to see colours of natüre...

Regent's Park is an ideal place to visit. The park is well maintained and well situated just outside the congestion zone with good parking. Very relaxing for walking with a good collection of wildlife and is close to many of London's places of interest.
Quite and amazingly beautiful!. You can go for walking and jogging, very nice and peaceful! Pass by regent's university nearby for curiosity, would love to spend more time there..

Beautiful park in the city of London. We went there after 221B backer street, it's just 5 mins walk from there, we were so surprised that how beautiful this park can be and so many different birds in the park.

Full of interest. We spent a couple of hours in the morning at Regents Park but we could've spent the majority of the day here. Its ideal for joggers,people out walking their dogs and anyone who is just out for a pleasant stroll like we were.Having a keen interest in wildlife we were amazed at the amount of species of ducks and geese that inhabit the park. On our visit we saw Egyptian,Canada,Greylag and Red Breasted Geese.Also Mandarin,Mallard,Coots,Moorhen,Smew,Pochard,Tufted Duck and also Black swans aswell as Mute and Whooper. A wildlife paradise for us...the pond also has more rare varietys of duck which must be part of a collection within the park as they are not species generally found in the UK. An awesome,well kept park that is perfect for relaxing and admiring in its beauty.Plenty of photo opportunities!

Beautiful. We'd had a great Sunday morning walk around Regent's Park recently and it offered everything..Amazing buildings surrounding it, well kept park including lake, kids playgrounds, football pitches, cafes etc and a great location near to other attractions.Much like Hyde Park, it's a great way to start your day in London... Very chilled out place, great for walking, running, family time etc

Beautiful oasis in the busy city. Just a couple of minutes walk from the Baker St Station is the beautiful Regent's Park. With all the hustle and bustle of travel and tourist attractions it was just so relaxing to sit on a park bench and watch the regal swans and all of the other water fowl. It is picture perfect and so serene!
Good green space in the city. One on London's great parks.A nice place for a stroll on a sunny day - go and watch the ducks and geese on the pond etc.
Great all year round. Great place for a bit of piece and quiet when the hustle and bustle of London life gets a bit too much.

One of the finest parks in Central London. Regents Park is one of the finest parks in Central London. The Gardens are beautiful and it is a great place to go jogging or spend the afternoon with your family.

Peaceful and well kept. If you want to get some fresh air and have a couple of hours spare, I'd recommend Regent's Park. Picturesque mix of lake/birds/fields/trees and gardens, bordered by some very grand buildings. There are paths all around the park, enough to spend a couple of hours.
simply perfect. favourite park in london... big green and beautiful!! a must visit when coming to london or you simply want to read a good book on the weekend!!

A great place in London. I always loved this park and the way it is structured, although I tend to avoid it when is warm on the north western part of it due to the kind of crowd is attracts.....My favourite is the wide space in the middle or towards the London Zoo where guys play football or cricket. There are also some wooden sculptures which make you think of the story of Amazing Mr Fox. Right in the centre you have the rose gardens, a cafe and a theatre where they have presentations when the weather is nice. Also the annual cooking event held between Regent's park and Baker street tube station.

The Best Park in London!. Amazing park, the flower section is so beautiful, the park in general is really nice, and well looked after. You can always find a quite place here. This is my favourite Park in London! and if you wanna go out for a picnic this is where you should come!There is also Tennis courts, you can have one of those River paddles things and paddle in the river.. Many ducks and swans here too!

Daughter studied at Regent's University. An amazing place for her to study as the university is contained in the park. The park is beautiful and also houses the London Zoo. She could find a thousand beautiful places to study or read. Very clean and well maintained. Worth seeing.

Time to kick the football around. My friends and I would come here on the weekends to get some physical activity done, and it was quite nice. It's a large space, where you don't run into others doing their own thing. It occupies the zoo, if you have time for that. It also hosts the Open Theatre, which I didn't get to experience. It's a very nice park, overall.
Grab food to take away and go to the park. This Park is just amazing. We both some sushi to take away and spend a lot of time sitting on the gras.

Régent's Park / London. This park is near Madame Tussaud's and it's nice to visit when you get tired to see to much people on this museum;The urbanisme of this nice park is fom Nash, an well known architecte of prince Regent; There are many attractions in the park;in summer there are open theatre attractions; also you can madea boats trip on the canal. In Queen Mary's garden you can smell the fragrance (perfume) of so nices roses.

Have a stroll.... Very well kept park, clean, comfortable.
No bikes alowed. You can buy a very good espresso at the entrance near The Ritz.
Lovely Park in the summer. Lovely park to walk around in the summer and the squirrels are very friendly which can be entertaining.
Nice Park. Very nice for walking and talking. Weather wasnt too good but still had a great day out. Would recommend if you like to wonder.

A beautiful park in central London. Regents Park is a great place to visit in all weathers. It has lots of lovely flowers, a rose garden, an Italian garden, a zoo, an open air theatre (summer only) and many other attractions. You can walk for miles within the park so a good place to exercise.
Peaceful and energising. Well worth a visit, especially the rose garden. Always well kept and pretty. Plenty of benches to sit down and have a rest.

One of the most tranquil areas in busy London. A great open space of Regents Park is an oasis in the madness of the London traffic.Just to the north of upper Regent street it's big enough to drown the noise of the manic traffic but also small to walk it across quite easily. Has beautiful greenery and flower beds and some lovely ponds and lake with wild life too.Spring time time you will be rewarded with fantastic flowers and especially roses.It's also the home of the London zoo.Worth a visit any day and totally free if you don't want to visit the zoo.
Great way to relax . Regent's Park offers the opportunity to relax and walk round a iconic park, plenty to see and it's well kept, tourists and locals are welcome

Lovely to stroll around. This is a lovely park to stroll around especially on a sunny day. There are lots of areas to sit and watch people walking by, plenty of places for refreshments. People on bikes can be a bit of a nuicance! The pigeons are on the watch if you have a packed lunch!
Stunning!. Absolutely stunning park in the heart of central London, great for clearing the mind and getting away from the noise of the city!
Beautiful park. Regent's park is one of the royal parks in London. It contains the London Zoo. You will see people playing various sports including cricket, football, tennis inside the park.
Spacious park with plenty of wildlife. Great mooching grounds. Beautiful lake. Nice cafe. Obese squirrels. Tame herons. And theiving pigeons.

Great place for a run. Keeping up a fitness regimen is always tricky while traveling, especially when traveling on business. One loop around the park is about 2.5 miles, so it's easy to repeat it a few times depending on how far you want to run.

Beautiful. You'd never guess you was in London!! Probably the most beautiful park i have walked through, so much greenery. Lots of pretty flowers, other walkers, children, bike riders and dog walkers. It has play parks and a cafes however we never used this but was busy at the time, great place for a picnic and games.

Great on a warm day. Visited here last summer and spent hours walking around, having drinks in the cafes and watching the kids in paddle boats. Amazed at how many young children were there with nanny's as opposed to their parents. Clearly loads of very rich people live close by.
nice. This park is also very pretty. I would still recommend Hyde Park given an option. But this is also very calm

Beautiful peaceful green space in London. If possible, try to time your visit to Regent's Park during the flower growing period. The roses are spectacular! Take a stroll around the pond near the roses to see the pair of black swans that live there. There are many playgrounds and areas to explore in this large park. The cafe offers healthy food and drink offerings as well as a loo. A great outing for the family!

More of a nice garden!. This park has a charachter. Not just a big park (like the Hyde park), it is more like a garden. You can walk and check different landscape, designed beautifully.So if you like to eat in the park, while in the "north" side, it is a nice spot to rest!
Pretty.... Stunning garden with beautiful flowers arrangement's and even in winter on a chill it's lovely. Good in the morning for an early wander...

Excellent place for a run!. Regents park is a beautiful spot for a run (or a really long walk). It boarders on Regents canal and the London Zoo (ZSL), also worth a visit. It is also adjacent to Primrose Park where you can climb the hill for a workout and a view of downtown London. Regents park is home to numerous sports fields including Tennis and Football (soccer). It also has some great cafe's, botanical gardens, bird ponds, and so much else to see while you are getting your exercise. Enjoy!

Better in spring/summer. Of course the best season to visit this park is on Spring/Summer to see all the flowers. But if you go in others months, is also good and enjoyable. Always is a good oportunity to relax your mind and body from the busy city.

Recharge your lungs. Apart from the stunning collection of flowers the best place to take long strolls amidst greenery in the heart of London. Easy place to reach and spend hours relaxing. Best visited in spring.

The Flower Garden. Great park! Best in the summer, hire a deck chair by it's lake and then head to the Royal flower gardens... A must see. But winter is great for some fresh air and a brisk stroll along the lake.
Worth the tube ride and walk to Primrose Hill. This is a not to be missed part of London. It is absolutely gorgeous! We walked up to Primrose Hill. The views of London are stunning!

Walkers paradise. We had never been around Regent's Park before. Last day in London so booked our bags into left luggage at Kings Cross and walked up Euston Road into Regents Park. We did a walking circuit of the whole park. It is wonderful. A variety of things to see. It was a dry day so that we had opportunity to see the wonderful properties that surround the park and the ponds and lakes in the grounds. If you have a young family and have time then visit London zoo which is in the park. Plenty of facilities, cafe, toilets etc. Well maintained.

Great stroll. if you start at Great Portland Street and walk all across the park, you get to Primrose Hill, where you have a wonderful view of London´s skyline. Keep walking and you land in Camden. It is a beautiful park and I wish I could have discovered it on a bike.
Great for sports!. A huge park within the city with wide areas of green places! It has cafes and too many sport facilities inside! There are numerous football pitches for free as well!
Park. This is one of the many parks in London.A beautifully laid out park.If you have time go for a walk and a good place to hang around .
Really chill. Great place for a relax, very beautiful Park. Only 30min walk to abbey Road and 30 to Camden. Great location. Sherlock homes is very close too

Grab a snack and go for a walk. Just grab a snack and go for a walk. You will sure feel relaxed and happy. There is something fantastic about this place one cannot explain and it sure is a place you must visit.

Spring in Winter. We visited this park on the Monday following Christmas. The weather was almost like a spring day quite warm and very sunny. There were a lot of people of all ages visiting, admiring the early onset of spring flowers and shrubs, so unusual at this time of year the park was very tidy all credit to the people who work there. You can walk, sit, run and play here, something for everyone and apart from the occasional plane and very muted traffic noise(completely absent in most areas) this is a very tranquil place to spend some quality time away from the city. Foot paths crisscross the park so you can cover as much of the park as you wish with plenty of seating for a break when required. An oasis in the middle of London it's great.

A Good Neighbor. Regent's Park is likely at its best in spring and fall. However, on the days it didn't rain until later, we walked the closer regions. Not a big fan of zoos, we skipped it, but when I come back in May I would like to see the architechture.

Hyde Park gets al the hype but Regent is the real deal. Love this park with all my heart. Spent many an evening at the open air theatre. You can still from Camden right though to Central London. No little. Incredibly green grass and rolling hills.
Green heaven!. Such a lovely place to relax, do some sport or have nice picnic. Especially in summer when you can lay on the grass.

One of my favourite parks . Oh I absolutely adore regents park. I think it's beautiful and one of my favourite parks in London. Lovely greenery and very well looked after. Close to primrose hill too which has a gorgeous view of the London skyline. Living in west London means heading to regents park can be a hassle, but it's definitely worth it!
Very nice park. The Regent's park is an excellent green area with lots of flowers and animals. We sar a little squirrel very close and lots of birds.

The best of the London Parks. What a terrific park. I went several times as we were across the street for 11 days. There were many things blooming and around every corner there was another surprise. The abundant wildlife was amazing. The winter garden is beautiful and the more time you spend there it is apparent that the locals truly treasure this jewel of a park. You can quickly see why the London Zoo was placed in this special park.
Beautiful, quaint park in London. Absolutely love this park for a lovely stroll in any season. I also regularly do the monthly 10ks that the park hosts which is a beautiful spot for a tough activity!

My favourite park in London. Always impeccably maintained, with endless paths, a lake, a zoo, an outdoor theatre, sports fields, and eateries. Open enough to feel safe and secluded enough to feel isolated. My personal favourite feature is the rose garden, when in season. It's the most quiet, luxurious park in London.
Nice park to stroll. Combine this park with a lunch walk right before or after a visit to Madame Tussaud or Sherlock Holmes museum. Kids loved the tame squirrels here in the park!!!
great family day out. Great family day out in the summer. Took a stroll around the beautiful park. very clean and beautiful gardens

Excellent child's play area. We only had time for a play in the excellent child's play area in the south end of the park.There is plenty to keep all ages of children safely occupied from toddlers up to pre-teens.Swings, various man-made and natural climbing frames, willow tunnels, sand, water, climbing cubes, massively high slide. Also there are boys and girls toilets. My 8 yo son loved playing in the new water feature.At the weekend/school holidays the little coffee shop at the entrance is open.
Amazing park for all family !!!!. Is the one most amazing London park. Nice rose garden, kids playground.I love this park so much especially in the summer time can't stay there all day long.
Beautiful. A beautiful Park. Lovely to walk through and remind yourself of just how green London actually is. Very peaceful.
Lovely park. Lovely park walkable in 20 minutes from Oxford street. Wide expanse of park and never seems busy. Love the peace and quiet of the place. Lovely place to visit all year around.

Running in Regents Park. What a blissful escape from the Christmas holiday hoards! Emerald green lawns, geese, storks, swans and peace all around. The park was glowing in the last sunny rays before the weather closed in again and we could return guilt free to a cosy pub - well worth a visit for a stroll or a run.

Time to explore. A beautiful Open-Air Theatre distinguishes this glorious park. Make sure you bring wet weather clothing, as I can guarantee it will rain during the Summer months! When this happens, the shows are often cancelled, depending on the severity of the weather, so be prepared to be flexible when booking tickets. Also a great space for picnics. Definitely worth a visit. Access for cycling also makes it a park to explore. You'll have fun.

Many parks in one.. Regent's Park contains so many different areas. The wonderful London Zoo, Queen Mary's Rose Gardens with 12,000 roses of 400 different varieties, the lake where you can take out rowing boats, the Open Air Theatre which is a must in the summer, the restaurant, and many more areas. One of the finest London parks, with fabulous Nash buildings surrounding it. Short walk from several Tube stations.

Being surrounded by peace and greenery.. One of the most beautiful and well cared park in whole London. Located right into the city center, accessible and free entrance for everyone, that's the best place for a relaxing walk, a run or simply get some relax peacefully surrounded by trees, gardens and plants. Seem to be in another world not even in London..

London's best park?. I love Regent's Park - there is so much to do: Taste and Frieze, the children's playground, the beautiful rose garden, the hub, the broad walk, the open air theatre. There's definitely something for everyone's!
Beautiful. Absolutely stunning park - great to look at baby ducks, geese, and swans in the spring. Grounds are beautifully kept, and a reasonable cafe on site.

The loveliest park in London. Regent's Park is one of my most favorite places in London. Plan your visit during the summer and be prepared to appreciate nature's awe-inspiring beauty. That's when roses and tulips are in full bloom and the clear sky makes everything picture perfect.
LOVELY PARK. Lovely park beautiful settings enjoyed a long walk with the wife not your average park clsoe to a tube station aswel with a lovely ice cream van soon as you walk in

beautiful, calm and serene. this park is so beautiful! when walking through it, its amazing that something as calm as this is in central London. certainly takes you away from hustle and bustle of City. it has so many things to visit, like London zoo and rose garden. the park is maintained very well and in summer it is absolutely stunning and best place to relax with beautiful flowers and fountains. something there for all ages and personalities
Beautiful, clean park!. This is. Great place for a long stroll. The park is clean and safe. There are a few cafes in the park and toilet facilities.

Green oasis in central London. Visited with friends from Scotland - we were in the area and it was a lovely Sunday so walked up from Marylebone Rd. Floral displays were very colourful and dramatic.Would have liked more seats available as it was busy and I am not able to walk far. We didn't have time to walk further than the first garden.

Perfect Nature Harmony. Huge green park! You will never want to leave there! Seems like heaven! And really good place to spend time with kids! Playgrounds, walking roads, cutie animals, beautiful lake! It is really unforgettable!

Lovely walk. The perfect place to go when the city around you becomes to much to handle. The park was far more beautiful than I was expecting. Its quite and calming, really helps you relax after being stuck in large crowds.
Great park. Great and peaceful place, perfect lawns, very clean, lots of chairs... a few coffee bars to make a break from walking around... great place to escape from city's crowd.

Lovely place . I really enjoyed my first spin around Regent's Park. The grounds are gorgeous, and are connected to the London Zoo, so you can visit both places in a day! A great place to run or play a pickup game of football.
A beautiful park. A peaceful oasis in the city. Had a lovely walk in sunshine and particularly enjoyed the roses - there were so many different sorts in a serene setting.
Beautiful Park. We walked through this park in the summer months - it is beautiful and I can recommend it to anyone visiting London so as to ensure you get to experience a great British Park.

Perfect Park. This park is huge, i never been there, when i was i loved it. Is a big park very clean, with lovelly gardens and flowers in the summer is stunning. There is a zoo there is a lovelly place for family, couples, children. Play ball games, chill during the summer.

If you love gardens.... Go and see Queen Mary's Garden, in Regents Park, particularly in spring. I visit every time I go to London and am delighted by the floral displays. It is magnificent! Have lunch in the cafe there.

A visit in Autumn was a delight. A wonderful park with easy access from all parts of London. The formal and informal gardens, the plentiful birds and squirrels (yes we Australians love squirrels!!), the lakes, the kiosks and the feeling of tranquility have made this a favorite park for us. It was great to see so many families with young children using the park as their "thoroughfare" to the zoo as well as using the designated sports areas. It would be a great place at any time of the year,
not bad. Theres a betuful mosque and if you go in the june/july time you may even be able to visit queen marys gardens to see the beautiful roses
Beautiful and peaceful park in the middle of London. I highly recommend taking a walk here with a good friend when you need a break from London's pollution and busy pace.

My favourite park in London!. All other parks are mainly for football and tourists. This park is unique with rose gardens, statues, fields, zoos, restaurants, rivers, waterfalls... Its worth making sure you can explore it all as every garden is so different.
Great Park. One of London's most well kept and beautiful park. it is great for a stroll, picnic or to see one of the great open air theatre shows!

Not as good as Hyde Park but still good. I like Regent's Park because there are bicycle paths in many parts of the park, if you like it bustling, then go on a sunny Sunday, it will be packed with people and kids as it is smaller than Hyde Park. It is also good for bicycle training, ride surrounding it and the road is good.
Something for everyone. Great family park. It has something for everyone. Walks, flowers, children's playground, fields and much more

Gorgeous green haven. Regents Park was a great find for our family of four. Plenty of playgrounds, beautiful flower beds and fountains, squirrels scurrying around and gorgeous wide open spaces for the kids to run around and let of steam. We enjoyed dinner at one of the many cafes, and there are plenty of maps to help you not to get lost. Highly recommended for families of active kids and people who love a nice walk in a beautiful park.

We had fun . Lovely place to hang out, specially with children.Some of activities that every family can do , playing outdoor games , take a walk, have a snack or coffee And don't forget to take beautiful photos for your children:)
nice park for london. this park is nice and relaxing and its an oasis of london tthe park is well mainted and its got nice seating too

Formal and informal, well-maintained. Regents Park doesn't have the great distances of Richmond or hyde Parks; it's altogether a more formal and polite sort of place. Hemmed by magnificent Nash terraces, it has walks, rose gardens, and well-judged plantings. Seek out the many 'hidden' gardens; you will have them to yourself.
Silence in the town. It was great time to be there. My small daughter was playing between the flowers and it was realy best time. My best recommendations for everybody

Needs Street Lights. Well, this is a big empty space, really more of a field to walk your dogs or play sports than anything else. It could do with street lights along the paths (roads?) because you can't go for a walk there at night.
Must go. Just love this place. Take your time to see the different areas. If possible, go for the gooey cakes at the café.
beautiful oasis of peace and quiet. London overall is a very busy and crowded city, we were glad to find this beautiful park and escape from the madness for a while...

Jeremy Piven ran past us!. Nice change of pace from the busy surrounding. It is not overwhelmingly big nor busy with tourists. It doesn't have too much noise generated from surrounding streets either.

Beautiful Park. Lovely big park, perfect for a stroll in the sunshine. Or to walk the dog, or see the flowers, or the surrounding architecture, or to go to the Zoo. And some nice little cafés if you need a snack.

spring time the best moment to visit. Big park and the perfect way for a walk from Camden to Baker street. Enjoying the plants, the gardens, the flowers smell...fantastic place to take some pictures and spend all day long.
Best London morning run. Come at the sunrise when you can avoid the crowds (yes, this is possible in London) and enjoy a run, a stroll, or a walk and a breakfast. Beautiful.

My favourite park in central London. Beautiful plants, fountains, nice lake, great rose garden and many squirrels in Autumn ;)
Perfect when you are fed up with the hustle and bustle of London.
Lovely & peacful park. This is a lovely park, lovely fountains and found a lovely coffee shop. Would come back in the summer.

Enjoy the Park and the Nash buildings. Walk further to Primrose Hill. It's called THE REGENT'S PARK, because it was built for Prinny. Its a mix of formal gardens, sports fields, water features and it contains a zoo and a theatre. Some lovely Nash terraces line it. Enjoy it and walk on to Primrose Hill beloved of William Blake. Check out the design shops on Marylebone Hight Street. Just do it!

Beautiful park. I always come here to relax and soak the sun.. if there is any.. :)
it can be also romantic and good for sports

Only if you have some free time. If you want to get away from the city, Regent’s Park is a nice place to go. We went there only because we had some free time (long story short, we were at Euston station and the park was close) and we really enjoyed it.I give it only 3 stars because it’s not worth taking the tube just to go there. If you are in Central London, go to St-James’s Park or Hyde Park instead. If you find yourself near the park (the London Zoo is close, the Euston train station too), its worth visiting.

Nice park, lots of walking. We visited on a rainy day, and the park is very nice, but its a lot of walking without seeing much. We could not find Speaker's Corner, but the river was very pretty and the walk was nice.

It's simply Regents Park. Beautiful.. I am a great fan of this park, and especially in Spring and Summer. A great place to stroll alone or with a friend. Or if the weather is bright and sunny then a picnic is the best option!
Nice Park in town. you could find yourself here just strolling through town and you will love the break from the building by entering some wonderful trees

Beautiful gardens!. This park is also on my "to visit" list as is the Kensington gardens during my every visit to London. This place is beautiful..well looked after, many beautiful flowers and other plants. There are few tennis courts available on the premises, there is also a pond and so many play grounds. Visit this park if you can, you will not regret it.

Flowers' Paradise. A beautiful, quiet, big green area in the centre of the city. You can lose yourself smelling the hundreds' rose variety in the garden, drink a coffee at the bar, visit the zoo or just waling in the park, watching a soccer or frisbee match.
Beautiful Oasis. Just lovely, you could walk for miles, Flower gardens, Lakes, sports areas, tea shops. Being a country dweller I found it to be be a beautiful oasis in the middle of a bustling city.

Green Heaven. Huge park here you can also find the London Zoo. Perfect for walk and run or just sit, relax and grab a bite. My favourite part of the park was the Queen Mary's Gardens, the small lake and the little waterfall are so beautiful even with colours of Autumn, unfortunately the roses were not flourish. Guess the park is even more stunning in Spring :)

Beautiful oasis in the heart of London. Well laid out formal gardens, great children's play area, surrounded by architectural gems. Temporary art exhibits are often located on the lawns adding interest.

Sunday stroll through park. Having walked up to Camden Market we walked back to the centre through Regents Park. Fantastic facility in the centre of London, and quite easy to feel miles about from the hustle and bustle of the streets. Plenty of paths, places to eat, lots of people playing football, with frizbees etc,. Sculptures and tame squirrels add to the experience.
Favourite park! :D. Favourite park in London so far! I just like it more than the others because it is not really pack, really clean and fantastic place.
One of the best kept parks in London. Lovely park just a nice walk from Oxford Street along Baker Street. Great mix of landscape, families and sport. Make sure you see the rose garden.
Boating lake is fun!. Regent's park is a nice little "secret". Usually much less busy than the other big parks. The boating lake is very fun and a good way to spend a couple of hours.

Lovely off-the-beaten-tourist-path experience. Our first and all too brief visit to Regent's Park has us looking forward to returning and spending more time to see more of this wonderful escape from busy London. Near the Baker Street station on the Tube - where you can also visit the charming Sherlock Holmes museum - the park is enormous and way less trafficked than Hyde Park, St.James Park, and some of the other central London parks. Beautiful and serene.

Very nice park. My wife and I spent an afternoon here on our honeymoon and it was great. We walked probably the entire exterior from the south entrance all around up as far as the zoo. There are nice flowers, pretty sculptures, a pond with ducks, the zoo of course, football fields and even paddle boats on a lake which was fun. Plus a couple of cafes scattered around. Overall a very nice day out and fun to explore. It is only a short walk from Baker St station.
Quiet. Stayed at the Holiday Inn at Regent's park so decided to take a walk to the park. Went there in the evening time. Was a bit quiet with a few cyclists.

best to visit in autumn and spring. speaking of royal parks in the heart of the city, Regent's Park is my second choice. if you happened to visit this park in autumn, don't miss the stunning yellow and red leaves here; but if you visit here in spring, you will also be engaged by its well cared flower gardens.
Rain, snow or shine.. Take an hour or more with some sensible shoes and simply meander this beautiful park. Your almost in the countryside with London all around you.

One of the most beautiful parks in London. On of the most beautiful parks in London in my opinion. It's really close to Little Venice too which is really cute. I think there's a zoo in the park too so great for kids.

Great place to run. So scenic, and with lots of different aspects (sculpted gardens, the water, a place to stop for tea, etc) that I love passing through here. Not as massive as Hyde Park, which means that most of it is not being cordoned off for a Christmas Winter Wonderland. Running through here is perfect!

A magnificent park . . . very well manicured!. We had been to London Zoo which is located within Regent’s Park. As we needed to catch a tube train back to our hotel at Paddington, we had to walk to the Regent’s Park underground station. Consequently, it was necessary for us to take a long but very enjoyable stroll through Regent’s Park to access the underground station.The park varies from areas of large open grassland environments, through tree lined avenues to formal garden beds with fountains, surrounded by masses of flowers.The formal gardens were a favourite of ours. They were full of colour and beautifully manicured.We walked through them as we headed south along the Broad Walk towards the Outer Circle.Regent’s Park is recommended a great park to visit and thereby escape the hustle and bustle of inner London. It is a magnificent park!

Well set out. An interesting mix of formal and informal areas. Definitely worth a look. Although autumn is not the best time to visit, on a good day when the sun is shining, the autumn colour and formal gardens are lovely. The rose garden would be splendid in summer.

Beautiful park, well maintained so big and spacious.. Regents park is so lovely and has so many different areas that it is suited for all, families, couples, friends and runners. I had a nice chillout session with my friend in the park lovely picnic, could not have asked for a better day.
Beautiful park. This was a lovely walk seeing birds up close and squirrels. On the lake beautiful ducks you wouldnt normaly see .it was a lovely long walk met lots of lovely locals and people.

Lovely inner city park.. I love regents park, it is a very pretty place to wander and explore and helps you forget you're in the city. Nice in any season - have just visited in the Autumn and the changing colour of the leaves makes a nice picture. Lots of artwork currently being exhibited in the park until 2016.
parks are my fav place. i enjoyed my walk through the park.i made sure that i visit all the parks in london.all the parks are amazing.
Black swans. Always impressive after walking through the rose arbours seeing the black swans (do they have young each year?) then all the tame herons and assortment of geese.
Weekend stroll. I was walking around the area on the weekend, and Regents park was really nice, especially with all the trees changing colour!

I think so far.. the best Park in London city. I found this park in the map and thought give it a try. When I first stepped in, I was like in Alice in the Wonderland. It was so beautiful. So peaceful and the primrose hill was awesome

An excellent way of exercising away from the hustle and bustle. Regent's Park is vast, but if you want to enjoy some time in peaceful surroundings, use your legs instead of the underground to cross from the Nottingham Hill area to Oxford street. Sit down by The Round Pont or cross directktly into Hyde Park by crossing The Serpentine. Have a snack outside at Speakers' Corner, and enjoy the speakers on a Sunday...
Very enjoyable. Wonderful park for a stroll, particularly in the Summer when the roses and all the other flowers are in bloom. Very popular park and a real treat within the city.

A Beautiful View and Flavor of London. We enjoyed all the London sites but Regent's Park was a delight to walk through. There were families playing games. Soccer was going on in one area and Rugby in another. We loved how the dogs were playing around everywhere. There were several people stopping to feed squirrels or pigeons. The London Zoo is located here but we didn't go in--so much more to see. We took pictures of the flower arrangements and eat lunch at a delightful bbq place, The Smokehouse, within the park. Because of London's convenient bus system we were able to get here without much difficulty and find a bus going right back to our hotel.

Love it. Beautiful park in Central London and definitely one of my favourites. There is so much to see there. During the spring, the place is absolutely blooming with flowers. It's a wonderful place for a picnic, in summer the Open Air Theatre is on which is brilliant and of course the zoo is right next door. Then you've got Primrose Hill at one end and views from there can't be beat! Love this place
Lively park. Lots to see here, from the formal rose garden to every different type of team sport playing on a Sunday morning.
walk a lot. we have come to this lovely and big big park to walk around and enjoy with our children is all so clean and very nice place to walk long walks with family and friends
Nice to relax. Great location and was so nice to relax a while on benches and people watch - beautiful roses in the garden

Beautiful gardens, the perfect spot of serenity in the middle of the city. Take a picnic!. I spent a beautiful sunny morning wandering around the gardens, taking in the relaxing atmosphere, and having a picnic breakfast with a friend.
The park is extremely well maintained, with lots of interesting areas to discover.
The perfect place to escape the city without leaving it. Take a book and a picnic and enjoy the gorgeous view,

Beautiful, serene and spacious park in the middle of London. I had never been to Regent's Park before, but we happened to visit it on a beautiful morning and it was a lovely contrast to the hectic sites and sounds of Oxford Street!
very nice place. We visited the park on a shiny Sunday. There were a lot of people and families. The park is well maintained.
My favorite outdoor spot in London. There is so much to see and the plants and flowers are continuously rearranged. There are some wonderful little spots and places just to enjoy.

Great for running. This park is great for running and just going for a walk around. It is massive so there is plenty to see and you could easily spend half a day just strolling around. I went running there in a Saturday morning and it wasn't very crowded and it was comfortable to go for a run and j wasn't being blocked by anyone just walking around. Overall it is a great park in my opinion

Great for a week day a early monring walk. Busy on weekends. Easy stroll form our hotel we went for a walk on a early Autumn day. The leaves were falling & the air was brisk. great start to the day. Found a coffee in the park . The gardens are well maintained but are very busy on weekends

Always in bloom. London has many, wonderful green spaces--Hyde Park, Green Park, even the small squares like Lincoln's Inn Fields. However, London has relatively few places you can go to enjoy the flowers. Regent's Park meets that need. Queen Mary's Garden in the middle always has lovely displays, the English Garden walk is impressive, and the flowers around the perimeter set this park apart. After a busy day, whether sightseeing, shopping, entertaining children, or working, it is so relaxing to immerse oneself in nature, especially the colorful nature of flowers. The gardeners of Regent's Park keep it in prime condition, and there is always something of interest, even in the dreary days of winter. But of course spring through autumn are its peak times.
My favorite park in London. I used to walk thru this park every single day to get to and from work - it's so beautiful and the London Zoo is located in it and is a great place as well

Lovely park to walk in with fields to play in. I visited on a Sunday morning and it wasn't very busy. It was lovely with trees showing different autumn colours. There are playing fields where people played sport and a couple of play areas for kids.
Absolutely beautiful and perfectly manicured.. Went to the Frieze Art Fair that was held at Regent's Park. This is a very well cared for park with each plant and blade of grass perfectly manicured.
Triton Fountain. Had a walk in Regents park mainly to locate and see in action the Triton Fountain a spectacular fountain easilt missed if just going to feed the birds or see the zoo.
Great Spot. This is a great place to spend your leisure time while your in London so make sure you visit Regents Park
Walked the Park End to End. We were in London during a Tube strike so we walked everywhere. Regents Park is huge with many things going on.

My Favorite Park in London. The title of my review says it all: it is my favorite park to visit in London. What a great and well mantained garden! the gardenerers taking care of it are really working hard on it. You have your wild and vast fields that people use to run or play football/rugby and then you have elegant and well kept gardened areas for a fantastic walk.
Amazing regent park. Enjoyed visiting regent park twice during my two weeks visit to London ... It is awesome and the lake with all the ducks really enjoyable
Beautiful fall colours. Experience beautiful fall colours of the trees are regent park during the month of October. Would love to visit again.

Lovely park in London. This is a lovely park to walk, run or just watch the world go by. There are a few different parts to it and a lovely cafe. An ideal place for picnics. Very well maintained and lots of groundsmen working on the day I visited. Something special if you have the time to visit.
a lovely park. a lake, nice to walk around, nice level of busyness but not overcrowded, geese, trees, lawned areas, nice building around
Love this park.. Go to the waterfall in the rose gardens. This park is lovely and there are lots of different parts to it.

One of London's most beautiful parks. My sister in law has a flat near to Regents Park. Carol and I visited recently and I went for my morning run around the area and did a number of laps around the park. What a great way to start the day.

Peace and quiet in Central London. This is a truly wonderful park. Filled with birds and squirrels; a peaceful place to go birdwatching or photographing wildlife. Can get a bit busy on weekends but the park is well tended and the flowers are lovely to see during most of the year. Watch out for kestrels, buzzards, parrots (yes, green parakeets are seen and heard nearly all the time) numerous wild fowl and very tame grey herons and squirrels. Rare bar-headed geese can also be observed. Early in the morning is best for photographers.

REGENTS PARK HOME TO LONDON ZOO AND MORE!. Regents Park is just north of Baker Street (Sherlock Holmes House etc.) The zoo is on the far north of the park and well worth a visit if you have time. Regennts Park is a huge santuary for your sanity amist the frenzy of London.
My favourite place in London. I just love Regent's Park. It has great wildlife, lovely places to sit and have a picnic or just chill, great snacky places and lovely to walk through.
A lovely big park in heart of London. A very nice park, you can feed the squirrels and pigeons there, very nice during spring and summer, can be a bit chilly during winter.
Heaven!. Amazing place for wheather I'm alone or with the family, beatiful, quiet, enjoy walking, running ... only sitting and doing nothing there is a bless.
My favourite park in London. It's a great place to be! It's full of flowers, has a boating lake, surrounded by the canal. It also has the Zoo in it and an Open Air Theatre.

Beautiful!. This is a very well maintained park. The gardens are abundant and beautiful! Many people strolling through local and foreigners. Expect to see friendly faces and small dogs. Very posh and be sure to grab a coffee once inside. Definitely worth a visit if your in the area!
Should visit for sure!. The place is amazing, if you have time you should definitely visit this place. There is not a lot of people in certain areas and you can enjoy the peacefulness.
Great London Park. Another of London's beautiful parks, formal gardens, wide open spaces, sports pitches, cafes, ducks, geese and swans and of course London Zoo.
Peace & tranquility in the city.. Lovely wander around this park on a Saturday morning, Well laid out and lots of paths to follow. Different areas well signposted.
beautiful. stunning park with beautiful views and so well maintained. There are a few food outlets for snacks, drinks etc
Such a beautiful place. It feels like your in a movie. The park is well taken care of and there is so much to do. There is a zoo, coffee shop, and of course the must visit rose gardens.
Lovely to visit in autumn. The Regent's Park is large with lots to see. There are some beautiful gardens and it was particularly nice to see the autumn leaves. Well worth a stroll around.

Nice park and run routes. A nice park with the London Zoo on the North Side. Recommend walking up the hill to get the views of the city. This is a great place to run... you can get in 4 -5 Km just by running the perimeter.
One of the best parks in London. Best time to visit is summers when the park is filled with blooming flowers. An excellent place to spend a day alone or with family.

Stunning place for a walk. The horticulture in the park makes it a beautiful walk. It is beautifully maintained and makes it feel quite secluded. Quite quiet by London park standards too, so this helps with the seclusion. Worth a visit.

Most beautiful park of London?. Regent's Park is my favorite park in London. He is sufficiently far so not every tourist visits, and sufficiently close to be walkable to Oxford Street / Piccadily Circus and other attractions.

Regent's Park - My favorite park in London - clean and stylish. Regent´s Park is my favorite park in London because it is very clean, stylish and always very tidy. There are lots of things to look at - esp. birds and trees of course. The houses surrounding this park are VERY beautiful and stylish indeed.

Drive thou the Park on a cool Fall day. We had a tour though the park as part of our city tour. got to see the wild deer and the Regents home fro before Independence. Everything is green and lush and everywhere we looked it was beautiful and restful. We got out of the car and walked for a bit and I was so happy we did. Gave me a chance to stretch my legs and enjoy the fresh air. This is a wonderful place to get out and enjoy a quiet walk or go to a Polo match. Yes there are a couple of clubs here.

A bit disappointed. I was a bit disappointed as far as big city parks are concerned. I walked across it from the Marble gate. There are 3 stops on the underground that are at the gates to park. It is a nice refreshing walk and there is a lot of birds and ducks there with explanations signs all about. I think I was expecting more with all I have read with respect to novels and references in movies etc. I guess one needs to stop off there - but I would not make a special effort if on limited time to go there.

amazing autumn colours. Beautifully designed and huge park offering so much. You can go to the zoo, play rugby, walk your dog, see beautiful colours in autumn, have a coffee or watching birds and nice plants near the lakes.

Beautiful park. Great park, well designed and a lot of hidden places that have unique and interesting bits. But what I like most about it is you're in the center of London but you could be in the countryside. Very relaxing and peaceful!
Great to visit when art fair is on. Fantastic to walk through the park for some fresh air or on the way somewhere rather than going by bus or tube.
one of the most beautifu parks in the world. walking along the park is really enjoyable. the contrast of colours in autum season is really lovely. u cant miss it!

Lovely green space in the heart of the west end. Long time since I had been to Regent's Park but my wife came here in the summer, so we popped back there on a visit to Harley Street nearby. Despite being autumn, the gardeners were lifting old plants that were over and planting up new things to give autumn interest. Nice to see that care and money is being spent to maintain the feel and tranquillity of the park. Well worth a visit if you are in the west end at any time. Take a few hours to wander round, take in the beds, water features, paths, etc and relax.

Nice to wander around. Green Park borders Piccadily and on the other side is Buckingham Palace so you are right in the heart of London here. It has many places to eat and sit down. Don't forget to check out The Bomber Command memorial at the corner with Hyde Park Corner which is very moving.

Regal and Serene. I love this park more than any other I have walked. It has its own special majesty and beauty. Beware the café it is pricey but still worth the stop to sip a coffee and drink in the peace and quiet. If you walk its breadth you can then hop on a bus and be in Oxford Street in under 15 minutes.
Always springs a surprise. Well worth returning. There is so much in the park, from formal gardens to sports (all year round) to simply acres of open space in the heart of London. Bliss

A surprising find. We had some time to waste as we had checked off a lot on our list and my husband saw this park on our map so we went to check it out. It was so beautiful, a great park for a nice stroll with nice gardens to check out. This was a highlight find for sure and we'll definitely stroll through this park again.
A walk in the Park. This is a lovely place to visit, great to walk through, and has everything in it you would want from a park.
An Afternoon Stroll. This park is wonderful, such a peaceful place to walk and watch the wildlife,. Was shocked to see how big it was and would revisit.
quirly sculpures. lent an interest to the visit on a grey october afternoonstill some colour in the flower beds although they are clearing some outgreat colours in the trees

Gorgeous park. London really is blessed with some amazing parks, but this one including Primrose Hill, is one of my favourites. It's gorgeous in the summer and a great place to go for a run, have a picnic or just a wander. It is extremely well kept and manicured. Starting to look great as the leaves turn colour.

Wonderful!. As this park was near my hotel, I made my jogging there and it has good dimensions for a run and shows you different landscapes and animals. It's easy to forget the pain when surrounded by such a landscape. Also ideal for a walk.

A little getaway in the City. Open Green spaces with open walk ways, plenty of trees, and a canal running through it with swans and birds makes for a pleasant little city escape within the city. Nice place to have a little lunch or go for a stroll.. not the nicest park around but it provides a green break in a city full of concrete and money makers.
Central London birdwatchers paradise.. A beautiful Park close to London Zoo,many birds that one would not expect to see,Herons,Cormorants etc. A lovely place for couples to go.
Lovely. You could easily lose yourself in this place. The sights, the sounds, the aromas - everything is a wonderment. Families with children will love it.
My favourite place in London. It is the best place to get away from the stress of London! We can enjoy of the nature and my childen played for hours there while I was resting with my wife!
A good place to visit. You can cut yourself away and forget that you are in central London. A good place to watch the World go by or to undertake people watching.
Nice for a stroll. Very nice quiet place to think and enjoy the simple life. Very pretty flowers and other foliage. Take a walk.

Great place to relax. Great place to flee from the busy city. The park is very beautiful, and it's also very relaxing. Next to that, it's also not so crowded as st. James's park for example (according to our experience).
Lovely squirrels and plenty of them!. I love walking through the park to get to the zoo. Lots of dogs and squirrels having fun running around. Lovely at any time of the year.

Lovely park. Passed through this park twice on my last trip to London, once early in the morning and once around noon. Both times it was lovely, with lots of animals near the water. Lots of dogs as well, though, so you should not be afraid of them if you visit.

Park Life. Regent's Park is one of the friendlier parks in London. I live nearby and I absolutely love the beautiful spaces and plentiful park benches - there's always a place to sit and watch the world go by!
Handy tip: If you need to get between Camden Town, Marylebone, and/or Primrose Hill, walking through Regent's Park is a great route!

lovely grounds. Hard to believe you are in the middle of a metropolitan city when walking through Regent's Park. Very well-maintained grounds with lovely flowers, water features and lake with lots of birds to see. An oasis in the city !

Beautiful Place. Perfect to come and disconnect from the busy London´s life.
The park is planted with hundreds of different roses, beautiful trees and has lot of beautiful fountains. You can feed birds and squirrels or just lie down and enjoy the beauty of the park.

London's Great Outdoors. Having never had the time to appreciate any of London's parks, we went on a lovely sunny day, the best way to appreciate the magnificent gardens. It's a great way to relax after some shopping.

Rough park. You can often find criminal elements in this park so I don't recommend you go when it's dark. During daylight, it's ok but nothing special. The only good thing about the park is the 5k races it puts on.

Better than Hyde park.. In my opinion it is better than Hyde park.
A smaller version though but is more attractive.
But do not compare.
Both have their own charm.

Smell the roses. Glorious in the sun, and atmospheric in the rain.
The rose gardens are just delightful - but I particularly like the little island in the pond.

Beautiful, interesting and peaceful. This park ha a lot to offer. Tranquil walks under the trees on the Broad Walk, flower beds and plantings, interesting art installations (we where fortunate to see the newly installed Frieze sculpture park), picnicareas, cafes, a big pond/lake with birds (swans, geese and other waterfowl) and many walking trails on all directions.

Nice Park. Went to Taste festival in Regents park, a lot of fun and a great way to discover a large range of culinary delights and wine. Definitely a great park, whether going for an event or a picnic
Gardens galore. Regents Park is a beautiful way to spend a morning. Breakfast in Queen Mary's Garden Cafe in the Rose Garden delightful.
best park ever. enjoy your day out in regent's park. very nicely design with many flower and trees. big space to enjoy all kind of activities.

Hard and Soft. This is an incredibly beautiful park, with both manicured and formal gardens with an Italian influence, as well as others with organic designs around ponds, John Books style. Great to visit at sunset and take advantage to shoot some photos during the golden hour. Problem is there's not many sunny days in London. Along the left end there are several embassies lined up, with stunning old school architecture.

Enjoyable and relaxing afternoon in the park. Our hotel was close to this park so we decided to unwind for an afternoon and take a walk here. It is a very beautiful and peaceful park and we discovered the zoo at one end of it, which we didn't know about. We had purchased the London Pass and the zoo was an included attraction so we decided to go in. It was small, but very nice. On the way back we stopped at a refreshment café in the park and sat outside with a glass of wine, enjoying the beautiful gardens.

In Wonderland. It's such a nice tradition to spend weekends with your family at parks. Regent park is very green and clean with roses and beautiful trees. I just kept thinking about Alice. It's great to have places like that to be at.

A very nice Park. Regents has the zoo in it so I passed through on the way there. Well manicured lawns and flower beds abound. Chestnut trees were dropping so I had my pick of the conkers. Quiet and not overrun with lots of people and tourists on a bright, sunny day.

Regents Park houses the London Zoo and is near Camden Town!. When making a trip to Camden Town - one of my favorite in London! You are close to Regent's Park and the London Zoo. Another of London't beautiful parks and green spaces. If you love roses this is the park for you as Queen Mary's Garden has 12,000 roses in it! Beautiful park and a lovely day outside in London! Don't miss Camden Town while in this area and the best burger & onion rings in Camden or all of London *I think* is at Hache located in Camden town just off the main street on a side street across from the big outdoor clothes market! Yummy!

W walk in the park. Wonderfully landscaped large park, pleasant to stroll through on a sunny day. It is flanked by a canal along which one can walk all the way to Camden. Add the zoo in the park and you can spend a day or two there. Lots of places to eat nearby and a great food area in Camden featuring numerous ethnic cuisines.

Beautiful Park. This park is beautiful and it is great to see the many gardens including the very large rose garden. From the parks that I had seen in London, this one is the most beautiful and is not overly large in scale. Walked through this park to and from the London Zoo.

Best Park in Central London - Hands Down!. Hands down, this is the best park in Central London. It's sizeable and spans two boroughs (Camden and Westminster). It houses everything from local faves (boating lake, extensive playing fields) as well as world-reknowned places (Queen Mary's Rose Garden, London Zoo, the open air theatre). And it also regularly hosts large events. There's plenty of different 'zones' to explore: v formal English gardens, many fountains, easy walking paths. And the planting is always lovely. My only complaint? The food venues aren't v good. And there's not much else close by, that doesn't take a good amount of walking to get to. So take your own, or eat before you arrive. Things to note: This is a Royal Park, which means that there are different rules and regulations which are not only different to un-Royal parks, but are also enforced. Have a look on the Royal Parks website before you go. And if you don't have time for that, then take heed of the signs... And most of all, enjoy! :)

Best Park and well maintained. This is one of Central London's best parks. With the Rose garden being an international attraction right in the centre. With a boating lake just over the road between the inner circle and outer. 3 miles around the outer circle brings you in touch with London Zoo. Lots of things for kids and family to enjoy. Theatre and tennis courts amongst other things this park is packed and brimming with things to enjoy.
Stunning through every season. Its an absolute must when coming to London.The park has so much to see and some beautiful walks. Its a delight to see so many families enjoying the park every weekend
regent park. nice park with cool atmostphere you can enjoy ur long and short moment here apart from the cocophony of oxford street

Great Park. This is the best London park in my opinion. The last time I was here it was a lovely, misty autumn morning and it was beautiful, the trees were all changing colour and it was perfect. Try to visit early before it gets busy.

Beautiful Park. Beautiful park bathed in autumn sunshine. Great vibe,tourists and locals, superb gardens. Huge green space in the heart of London.Regents Park zoo is well worth a visit but some animals can be glimpsed from the park.
Great brake from the city :D. Fantastic park! Ideal for short or longer brake. And is just in the central London. It's good option to take a shortcut to get to London Zoo.
Stretch your legs a bit. In nice weather, this is a great place to take a stroll. We enjoyed sharing the space with young moms and their children.
Must see. Nice and clean this is one of my three favourite park of London. With green areas and air to breath is a must see
Time out. A wonderful place to relax and people watch. It is very difficult to imagine that you are in the middle of a huge city. Take time to visit this lovely park

One very beautiful park in London!. I often go for a walk in this beautiful park. I love the rose garden with a very large variety of English roses. The lake with the ducks cannot be missed. It has an open theatre and various cafes. On one side, near Primerose Hill, you can see some of the animals from the zoo. There are many sport pitches and you can also walk alongside the canal. I think it has everything you can wish for. The vegetation is varied and you have several points of access to it. Highly recommend!

A peaceful oasis. I spent a couple of hours in Regent Park just strolling & people watching, checked out the most amazing Rose Garden and eventually found a park bench to rest a while. Then met an 80 year old man who lived opposite the park & listened to his amazing story. Beautiful day.

Tranquility Base. If the noisey crowds of Oxford Street or the buses or the 'tube' or cars everywhere are getting to you, get yourself to Regents Park for some tranquility. Its possible to walk from here to Little Venice to see the Canal Boats in Paddington OR you can walk a way to Camden Market for a lively cosmopolitan experience. Don't forget the famous Regents Park Zoo is situated here too. You can just watch the well kept Gardens as walkers and joggers pass by breathing the relatively fresh air away from the traffic. We passed through here for a peaceful rest for half an hour before 'hitting the road' again. London has some large parks and this is one of the nicer ones situated in the NW of the centre of London.
Lovely park!. It is a good park to spend a quality time with friends or family or just drop by. Nearby is a Primrose hill which is worth visiting as well.
A four season delight. one of the best place in London! close to transport, birds, boats, open air concert, rose garden, island, little hills, open air theatre.... what not to love?!
Beautiful park to walk around. The park is beautiful, there are lots of people running and doing some exercise. Beautiful for a walk and close to some other main attractions.
Tranquil haven. Fabulous peaceful haven/area to walk in the middle of London. Can rent boats on the lake or watch the world go by.

A gorgeous garden. Fabulous rose gardens alone are worth the trip to this lovely park. In June it was calm, peaceful and most roses were in full bloom or just ready to burst open. The delphinium garden is worth the trip, too. Who knew there were so many colors of delphinium?

Sunny Afternoon in Regent's Park. We had a lovely walk through Regent's Park toward Primrose Hill. I highly recommend taking tea in the park at one of the cafe's. We had our tea with scones top with jam and clotted cream. We took the Broad Walk then veered over to the waterway North of the boating lake to do a bit of birding, then made our way to the canal and walked to the entrance of Primrose Hill. Lovely and relaxing.
Love x. Just love this park, one of my favourites. Be sure to visit if visiting London! Take a walk, have a picnic and just enjoy :-)

Deckchairs in the Park. Loved walking around the park seeing the roses, fountains, water, birds being fed and people on the deckchairs. It was quite funny seeing people rush to the bandstand with their deckchairs when the rain started. Lovely place to have lunch and find some peace and quite on a beautiful day.
Fantastic afternoon stroll. Beautiful escape from the rush of London. Lovely gardens and park benches make for wonderful opportunities to rest and people watch.

The best park in LDN. Regent's Park is great. There's a lot of different scenery and it's a beautiful place to walk through or have a picnic. You could easily spend a good few hours here, although take food with you as the vendors are expensive.

Peaceful - away from the hustle and bustle. Beautiful green and luscious park. Plenty of nice fountains and flower arrangements, along with the usual squirrels. Great route to take on the way to the zoo, if you've arrived at the Regents Park stop on the Bakerloo Line. Plenty of wild grass, dogs running around and people kicking a football around on one of the fields. Peaceful and relaxing walk.
Stroll in beauty. A marvelous, lovingly-tended garden in the heart of London, yet quiet and peaceful. A delightful place to spend a couple of hours.
Always a joy. Always delightful. I took Mum a couple of days ago for a walk and coffee. We enjoyed walking near the football pitches and seeing the meadows.
A must see when visiting the Capital. Wonderfull piece of English Historic Archetecture never been inside but feel pivalaged to have seen the outside

I've always loved this park. It's a must visit if you're in London.
It's not quite as big as Hyde Park but certainly just as interesting.
The zoo is near by and primrose hill is a short walk. A must see at sunset.
Heaven . Beautiful ! Worth walking all around it watch the different types of roses and beautiful scenery I loved Hyde park more but this one is a must visit so peaceful ❤️
The best park in London!!. This is literally the best park i have been in London. If you go with the family for walk or jogging this is the right place to be.

Stunning! Worth a walk through.. An absolutely beautiful park. Well maintained and there are maps at main points to guide you if you don't have your own. I was only in the park for an hour and didn't get to see a great deal of it, but what I saw I highly enjoyed. The rose gardens are particularly beautiful, and make you actually want to stop and smell the roses (which smell amazing by the way). There are benches lining the paths which allow you to really take in the beauty of the park. In Regents Park, I almost forgot I was in the centre of London! All that lush greenery dims the noise and is so peaceful. The avenue gardens are also worth a walk through if you like symmetry. I only wish I had had more time to spend there.

Fresh Air. I also ended up at the Regent's Park by coincidence and it was a great one. Very clean park with ducks and pigeons being fed by tourists. You can see people reading by the beautiful flowers and just relaxing watching the others paddle their way in a the lake there. It felt great to be away from London's urban scene for a while and get a glimpse of natural beauty and a whiff of fresh air.

Very nice and well kept park. Beautiful and well kept park with lots of opportunities for great photos. Be advised that there's a closing time, and once the gate closes you are on your own as to how to get out, which is not an easy task.

A slendid afternoon. Me and my sister decided to go here last minute. There were cute snapchat filters and we got a KFC and just sat on the grass with the beautiful sun hitting us and the summer white flowers cushioning the landscape. Such a wonderful park, can't wait to go again!

Heavenly!!. It is an absolute heaven!! I want to say the most beautiful garden I have ever seen so far! So elegant and antique, makes you really feel in a royal garden but opened to everyone. Totally worth a visit!!
Beautiful Public Garden. Beautiful City park with manicured lawns and formal gardens. Go on a Saturday and see multiple weddings/ wedding parties celebrating in the park.

Heady scent of roses at Regent' s Park London. Absolutely delightful to be here in early Autumn.The flowers bloom and the leaves still green but some turning into autumn shades of many hues.The Queen Mary's Garden with its variety of flowers and especially the various species of English roses. Beautiful blooms of so many colors will just charm you into staying longer to partake of the visual and heady scent of the roses.The swans and pigeons can be handfed, and seeing the swans and ducks gracefully gliding in the lakes is both serene and peaceful. You can take a boat to pedal on the lake for a small fee.Nature at its best this time of the year.
Frieze. Totally beautiful venue for frieze London and frieze masters it's as if you've left the hustle and bustle of the capital well and truly behind you

secrets. I heard that Not everyone even in London knows the Secret Garden. If you need a quite time in a very busy London, go find the secret garden. Tranquility, Nature at best. It is also good if you have little kids, they can run around in St. James great lawns. I am trying to make an habit whenever I am in London, I make sure I visit Regent's Park. You may not see too many tourists there as

Beautiful stroll through magnificent gardens!. We were lucky to have a pleasant, warm and sunny day to take advantage of a stroll through Regent's Park. The garden displays were in full magnificent bloom and there was much beauty to be enjoyed. A wonderful experience in the 'nature' of London.

Park and Zoo. We visited Regents Park on a sunny day and enjoyed the tranquillity. We then visited London Zoo and enjoyed seeing all the animals which seemed content and well cared for. Coffee was pleasant although service was slow.

A quieter green oasis in London. Regents Park is a wonderful park to walk around to get away from the hustle and bustle of Central London. There is a lake with boats, lots of birds, a beautiful rose garden and very interesting architecture. It's also home to London zoo and a vast variety of trees.
Lovely park. Enormous park, lots of trees, gardens, lovely place to walk. Like everything in London there's lots of people there but then there is plenty of space

Exquisite!. Regent's Park is one of London's wonders. Over the years we have visited many times and in never fails to satisfy. I have fond memories of my now thirty-something son's awe when facing a striking black mamba at Regent's Park Zoo when he was four years old.The gardens are exquisite and beautifully maintained. There is a variety of activities available, from rowing a boat on its lake to simply lying on your back and watching the clouds pass overhead.
