Wildlife in Regent's Park. Such a beautiful park - tall trees, grassy areas, rare and unusual wildlife, and I even handfed a squirrel! So take peanuts in shells with you!!

An Oasis in the City. Relax on a nice day in a large landscaped park. This area was near the heart of the Industrial reveloution of England. A don't miss is the Canal history the canal , Regents Canal was a highway for goods and services from the Thames to interior England.Camden Town nearby should be a must see.
Exquisite gardens. Magnificent gardens. Spacious and lovely. A perfect way to spend a nice afternoon in London if the weather is good.

Gorgeous park!. This is a gorgeous park! Do not miss a walk through this beautiful park if you ever visit London. Spring and Fall are especially fabulous times for a visit. Spring flowers make exquisite photo ops.
Beautiful park. Visited Regent's Park during a trip to the London Zoo. Lots of lush green grass and a canal running through the park. Nice place to exercise or just relax. Easily accessible on foot.
Wonderful park. Wonderful park with lots of paths to choose from. Plus it's close to some nice attractions and not too far away from one of the main shopping areas.
Nicely planned green space in London. A huge park in the heart of London, great for joggers, cyclists, dog walkers, family picnics and couples.

Lungs of London. London is blessed to have so many parks around, specially in and around central part. Its a great place to have a walk or a picnic when the weather permits, we were lucky all August, almost.
Lovely park. Beautiful garden, specially on a sunny day, full of bloom flowers everywhere , between spring and summer, nice place to chill or take your kids there.
Beautiful. Love going there during the day time and evening. Especially pleasant in the evenings - relaxes and rejuvenates. Beautiful rose garden is something not to miss!

Terrific park; the true beauty of London is here.. London's Royal Parks are always a wonderful experience on a sunny day. Get in touch with the natural world, enjoy some peace and quiet away from the bustling streets and pollution. Today, I saw six grey herons, motionless by the water, within the space of ten metres; enjoyed the scent of several varietyies of rose, had a reasonably priced "picnic" lunch at a healthy of somewhat snobbish espresso cafe; and happened across a wedding party of (guessing) Coptic Christians.

One of the most beautiful parks in London. Regent's Park is a real oasis of beauty with beautiful plantings and walkways you will find yourself feeling relaxed and at the same time engaged by its lovely design. The scale of it is perfect for a step away from the busyness that surrounds it. After you have had your fill of the park its nice to go onto Marylebone High Street for a villagey wonder, keeping the feeling of happy repose going that bit longer. For me the makings of a perfect Saturday.
What a relaxing site. Beautiful Walk through the park will lead you to the an area where you can sit and watch the horses being rode through park.
Best park in London. Amazing for kids. Nice kids playground that is reachable by bus ( the other side to the entrance of London zoo) and less crowded than hydepark.
Lots to see for the whole family. We loved this branch of London's lungs. Spent hours walking the paths and avenues, exploring the playgrounds and gardens. Highly recommended.
Relaxing and pretty. Peaceful and extensive gardens close to our hotel. Lots of roses and generally a pleasant and relaxing afternoon.

Diversity in one place. I am a great lover of Regent's Park because in different parts it is different. It has an Open Air Theatre as well. Not to mention, nice cafes and pools full of swans and ducks. I like going there with a book and a blanket, to read and have a nap. Sometimes, you can see green parrots, hanging out on top of the trees. Amazing!

Regents park - stunning on a sunny day. On a whim (and a rare sunny day in late September) we decided to visit Regents Park. My partner was dubious as the entrance was somewhat unassuming, with unkempt grass and nothing much else. However, on rounding a corner we came to the Queen Mary Rose Garden. This was spectacular and all the roses were in bloom, impressive itself at this time of year.We spent quite a bit of time in the formal and ornamental gardens as they were beautiful. Not that peaceful as everyone else in London seemed to have the same idea, including several wedding parties! But lovely nonetheless.We then just wandered around past the (huge) boating lake and children's play area, enjoying the surroundings and the sunshine.We then walked to Primrose Hill but that's for another review!

Amazing place. Very impressive Park, nice to walk through or just to sit in if its not raining.crossed the park in 1-2 hours of slow walk, very clean and quiet.lots of football fields and couple of coffee places to rest and admire the view

One of my favourites parks in London. I love to walk from Primrose Hill to Baker Street, enjoy the lake and the bridges, the people walking around and playing football. It is just like leaving london for 20 minutes...

Best Park in London. To come to London and to spend time in a park is a proper way of seeing our town. If you are on a limited time budget and only have room for one day at the park, skip the tourist havens of Hyde/St James/Kensignton and go to Regents. Strikingly beautiful, extremely open and really makes you feel like youre somewhere else. Side note, go to the North end of the park before you leave and climb Primrose Hill for the best view of Londons skyline.

Gorgeous, Post Camden, avoid walking near the zoo!. I really enjoyed walking around the park. Despite there being numerous sports teams practising, and the occasional tourist group passing (it being the weekend and summer and all) it was mostly serene and a great place to chill out after having walked around Camden Market. One thing I must say though is to avoid walking near the zoo, which is incredibly loud and does not have very attractive borders... Enjoy :)
hanging out with children. Good park for letting the children play and run around for a while when doing London. London Zoo is adjacent.
Beautiful park. The most impresive park we have been to in london the rose garden is not to be missed with london zoo at the upper part of the park it can feel that you are far from the city.

Lovely setting. Lovely park well laid out with masses of different plants and trees well worth a leisurely stroll. Went when I was younger with my mum it doesn't seem so big now but still a lovely place.

Nice Place to visit esp. in Spring and Summer. It is a nice beautiful place and very well taken care of. In Spring and Summer there are lots and lots of beautiful flowers around the park!
But if you are here for couple days only there are much more to see :)

One of the Very Best Parks in London. My favorite park in London. More quaint feeling than Hyde Park (it is smaller), with lovely rose gardens in the summer, and shade trees along the waterways. Super to bike through from Camdentown to Paddington or Maida Vale. Zoo there, I've not visited.
Beautiful place. Hard to rate a park, but it has gorgeous views and great benches to sit on to appreciate nature. Also at the end you'll find the London zoo.
An amazing park. This park is perhaps one of the most beautiful parks in London and is definitely worth visiting if you have the time or could be bothered.
time out. Regent´s Park is a nice and peaceful place to relax from busy London and to take a walk. Easily accessible by the Tube
Met my GF here. I met my GF here, 20 years later, now married. We go here sometimes as a reminder. Its the best park in London. Love the park.
Great stroll. Took some time off our schedule to walk through the park instead of rushing around and didn't regret it. A fine example of British public spaces.

One of the best parks in London. Our local park so regularly go jogging, walking, picnic-ing or play cricket here. Often overlooked compared to other London parks, but would recommend walking round edge of London zoo to see free animals and walking around the canal. Walk up and over to Primrose Hill. The Open Air Theatre here is also amazing and I would thoroughly recommend trying to see a play here amongst the trees and the birds. In summer this park becomes somewhat overrun with companies softball teams which is annoying.

Amazing park. I have worked for local authorities managing parks so I am familiar with the challenges of keeping a very busy public park safe and beautiful - Regents Park is an amazing site. Beautiful ornamental areas, sports fields, unique play areas and acres of well maintained grass land ensure that there's plenty to do and enjoy.
Lovely sunny day. Masses of herons. Also visited the central London Mosque - members were very welcoming to non Muslims.

Summer Trip. The park is beautiful, we walked through it on the way to the Zoo and the kids had a great time chasing pigeons! There was a gentleman making bubbles with a bucket soap and a rope and he was really good with the kids.

quiet solitude. amazing Queen Mary gardens within the park. Gardens are well maintained and colorful. great energy in the summer. Perfect for an early morning run or stroll. See the water falls and ponds
Fabulous . A gorgeous park with lovely plants and a great cafe. The pedal boats are really fun and the cafe beside them is great! Totally wonderful, and worth a couple of visits.

calm and relaxing. on our way to zoo we walked through this park. and noticed that its one of the biggest and finest parks that we've ever seen. the nature was really beautiful tall trees, green grass and so on. very relaxing place.

A pleasant surprise!!. Not sure why I've never visited here before and only popped in on the way to somewhere else...glad that we did!! If you like gardens...its a gem and on par with many National Trust gardens! Beautiful, well managed beds and borders...fountains and friendly squirrels pestering you as you walk around. Free to enter and easy to lose an hour here! Still plenty to see in September...lots of colour.

Roses galore. We were staying in Islington and walked here along the Regents Canal towpath. The problem with the towpath is sharing with the cyclists no the runners. There is no problem however with Regents Park. The only tip is to make sure that you visit when the roses are flowering as Queen Mary's garden in one of the most beautiful gardens you will ever see
One of my favourite places in London. So much greenery and quietness in the heart of busy London! Especially great place for runners and children :)
Beautiful park and gardens.. Gorgeous park and gardens. Perfect to stroll through or sit and watch dogs trying to chase the squirrels!

Outstanding Royal Park. Outstanding Royal Park, having an historical Zoo and specialists in all forms of animal science,
An enviable historic open air theater,gardens, boating lakes
Well maintained, policed, and available by most means of transport
Enjoy the beauty. Beautiful park, numerous roses smelling so sweet. Excelent place to rest from the crowdy city and just sit or walk and enjoy the beauty :)
Park full of energy. Park of beautiful garden but also full of people who've come to play soccer, frisbee ... And another plus is beautiful zoo.
Gorgeous park and beautiful roses. Absolutely gorgeous! I really didn't expect such beautiful gardens and scenery here. It is a quiet, relaxing park to visit.

Nice park. Very big park and it will help you reaching the Buckingham palace.
You can get down at a tube station and then cross this beautiful park to get to the palace.

A treasure in London . Decided life was short and needed to smell the roses. The rise garden on Regents Park was stunning. It's the perfect place to explore if you love amazing gardens. Hidden treasures around every corner. A treat for all of the senses.

Rose Garden. It is a nice park with so many roses. They are all named. It is pleasant to walk along the inner cir. The cafe offers hot drinks and sandwiches. It is a good place to stay after the walk.

My favourite London Park. Among all the parks in London Regent's Park is definitely my favourite. Everytime I decide to go to Camden, unless I'm in a hurry I prefer to stop here and cross the park by feet to reach the north side of the city. Is very well mantained and I love the inner gardens and the inner circle.

Typical English Park. We all three persons had a nice walk in the park. It was very big. There is inside ring. We saw many birds, big grass and spacious field, water and different kinds of flowers, especially the roses. We have seen so many types of roses before visiting this park. We had a snack meal and coffee in a restaurant. So enjoying! So relaxing!
Beautiful park. Beautiful park. Nice gardening and flowers. Lots of birds and squirrels. A calm and relaxing atmosphere.

A quiet walk in the midst of a mighty concrete jungle. If you stay the Paddington side of London and want to get to most of the attractions on the other side a walk through this park is a must. Hard to imagine such beauty in the middle of London but there is. Go for a stroll, run of cycle throug this green wonderland and it does not cost a cent (or a penny). A must for a visit to London.

Love, love, love!. Didn't mean to actually come across this place, more of an accidental find!The Park's located right next to London Zoo - was meaning to find this but we stumbled across the gardens here.Such a relaxing place. Really something special! & the flowers & water features are lovely.It's so peaceful - great photo opp's!
Rather big gem. A rather big gem neatly stored away in the big city of London beautifully maintained and looked after the park is stunning and home to lots of widlife.

A Very Lovely Sunday . I went there with my friends in last month and I LOVED it.To be honest London's parks are amazing but Regents Park is the best I've ever visited. If you don't like plain parks if you like trees and flowers and statues you must visit ! Also you can find squirrels, seagulls, swans and pigeons... It's also very comfortable place for having a lovely picnic with your friends and family...
nice stroll. This is a very pretty park to walk through. Maybe one of the best that London has to offer. If you are visiting definitely try to take leisurely walk around the park

Impressive Gardens!. The Perfect getaway from the city!It is large and expansive right in the heart of the busy City.Close to the tube, an oasis for everyone. Kids and youngsters can enjoy many activities out here.We just had a relaxing walk after a hectic sightseeing.Be sure to come to the lake. You can spot a black swan out there and the park is even more beautiful in spring.

A delightful Sunday in the park. A lovely place for a leisurely walk and spectacular if you go in early summer when the roses are at their best. The lake is beautiful with lots of fascinating birds swimming on the water and flying around. The cafe is perfectly adequate but don 't expect too much. Of course the more energetic have plenty of good paths for running or walking.

Gardens to impress. Spent half a day walking the park. This is a very big park with a good amount of birds. The high light of the park are the gardens. The interior gardens are ornate and seem to be aimed for the royal family originally. The English gardens to the south side are worth walking due to the size of the gardens and the good set up of the beds and statues. I recommend this for a good way to spend some down time and do something for free.
well maintained. nicely manicred lawn, clean walk ways and beautiful arrangement of flowers.I loved the walk while it was drizzling.
stunning. this is a beautiful park within London; the flowers are stunning and you may see someone playing boules on the lawn. Very peaceful and during the summer you can watch outdoor theatre.

Best Park in London. Best park in London. It's in the north part of London and has plenty of space to go for a run, to play cricket, football and to just lay around and prepare a pic-nic. Worth visiting.
very. water.grass.green.sun.clouds.bicycle.run.people.love.sport. Only well words can write about this place. Recomend to visit.
Lovely place to sit back and relax. Beautiful gardens and a park area for the kids. Lovely to sit back, after a day sightseeing, and relax watching people going by.
Summertime Heaven. Great for a stroll around the park to meet friends and make friends. Perfect for a sunset walk after a trip to the busy shopping streets.

A Walk in the Park. I went to Regents Park and it was gorgeous. Very clean and all the plants, ponds, fountain and flowers were kept with immaculate care. The roses were simply spectacular! And squirrels, ducks, swans and all sorts of animals can be found here. Great place for a relaxing walk and the open aired theatre and zoo are also close by!
Lovely for a walk and on the lake. walk in the sunshine and fresh air, nice icecream and then a leisurely trip on the lake on the pedalo's. Great afternoon
Great park. An excellent escape from the city with plenty of birdlife, including the tamest herons in the world. Not as busy as the other London parks.
A nice escape from the city. If you are looking to escape from the city, this is a perfect place to relax. The fountain and gardens are beautiful and highly recommend a visit here.
Fabulous park for walks and reflection all year round. Beautiful, huge park. Lovely walking routes. Great variety of ducks and birds on the water you can feed. Really clean public toilets too.

Clean, well groomed park. After exploring the Sherlock Holmes Museum, do take a stroll through Regent's Park. We walked the inner circle and through the Jubilant Gates. The park was nicely manicured and groomed. Several wedding photos were taking place as we strolled. You will see several ponds and pidgeons as you walk the grounds.Great to let the little ones roam and play if you have a few moments. I would recommend grabbing a bite to eat at the little cafe as well. Clean bathrooms and a quick grab to get you on your way.

Regent's Park open air theatre- Lord of the flies amazing!!. I and my mum went to Regent's Park open air theatre, and saw Lord of the flies. It was incredible. It was literally in the middle of the park, and it was so symbolic and I have read the book, and I think the acting was superb, it's like walking into a jungle!!!Pigeons and butterflies flew around you! It was perfect, I had a burger as well, as you can get vouchers. It was really like you were in the middle of the island, because the set was so amazing!!!It has definitely been one of the best productions I have seen, I would really go again!! It is quite hard to find. If you go through the golden gates, and then turn left and go straight on, you should find the reception area. I think the production would not really be suitable for 7-9 year olds because of the savages and killing people, but 10 upwards it should be ok, and they should understand the storyline and the symbolism. I'm eleven, and am nearly twelve, I've read the book and know the storyline. It was a brilliant production, it's a great experience!!!!

Peaceful retreat in London. Away from the hassle and bussle of touristy London lies Regents Park which is so peaceful. Locals walking their dogs, swans , ducks swimming in the lake, loads of benches around and even more space for long walks without other people bothering you. If you need to escape the crazy London hectic pace come here to relax. Great escape.

A Lovely Park with Lovely Gardens. Regents Park is a short walk from Baker Street tube station or even Great Portland Street tube station. I personally think it`s one of London`s best parks so very kept and lots to see, if you like rose`s then you have to see the Queen Mary`s rose gardens in mid summer they are amazing the smell of all the roses is so wonderful. There is a great little eating place next to the gardens and not over priced at all. Then just around the corner you can walk to London Zoo.

A wonderful place for a walk. We decided to walk from our car park through Regents Park, I am so glad we did the roses were still in full bloom and smelt wonderful. I have never seen black swans before today, but they were on the lake so majestic. A wonderful walk through. We did seem to get a little lost at times but that didn't matter. A fantastically well maintained open space
Fabulous scenery. Fabulous park, lovely fountains , scenery, breathtaking a must see, great. Views, birds , landscaping.
Stacks on offer….. There is always somewhere inside this park that puts a smile on anybody's face. Plenty of benches, space to walk and unwind…oh and even a zoo!
A great place to enjoy nature at its best.. A beautiful place to take a walk and enjoy the water, nature and birds. It is beautiful and relaxing after a long day in the city! A good place to unwind.
Green, green and green. Big park near Baker Street and North Gower Street. So an nice place for a picknick for all Sherlock Fans.

An enjoyable way to spend a couple of hours. After some hectic sightseeing we needed a bit of peace and quiet so headed for the park, only one stop fro the bustle of Oxford Circus but a different world. Some very nice flower displays and a pleasant walk around the lake recharged the batteries before we headed back to the shops.London is a better place for having its parks especially for those of us who hate the noise and clamour of the city.
Queen Mary's Rose garden. The Rose garden is very beautiful and a must see. Park is located close to Madamme Tussauds Wax Museum

Amazing green space. Lovely inner city park for family's and walkers.
It boundaries London Zoo, so its nice to visit after spending a day in the zoo. Lovely gardens, fountains and places to sit - or run around with a ball if your a bit younger!

Central park with some lovely gardens to relax in. Such a large and expansive park right within the centre of London. Some nice cafes located within the park as well as London Zoo which is great. Very relaxing just to sit in the park and walk around it on a sunny day.

Yep!. It's a lovely park. The attract should really be referred to as Regent's Park and Primrose Hill. The park houses the Open Air Theatre, London Zoo, and Primrose Hill. Primrose Hill is the country's largest free to access waterfowl and wild bird parkland site. There a days outing easily. If you have little kids it's too large and you might be best sticking to the Zoo. Otherwise, marvel that this is the centre of a major city.
Nice bike riding area around the park. The park looked very pretty, however, bicycles are not allowed inside so I just rode around the perimeter of the park.
quite london when youve had enough. stunning lots of birds and acctivities for the kids close to baker street tube and big houses around the edge

If you are in London you can not miss it!. If you see the sun outside and fancy a relaxing walk just go there! Lovely place to have fun, relax and also to see ducks and a lovely view of the London eye!

The Zoo, the Queen's Garden.... A must see when in London; a day in any of the parks is well worth your visit. The Zoo, while good, a little over-rated/over-priced. However, makes a fun day for the family!
Beautiful park. A lovely park that is well maintained and perfect for evening strolls in the good weather or trips out with children.

A must go on a Sunday!. I love all the parks in London, they're all perfect getaways from the city. But Regent's Park was the one that captivated me the most! We were recommended to go there on a Sunday, and I totally understand why: that's the day when people from London go there with the family to have picnic on the grass or play sports in the huge green fields. There's a lovely roses garden inside the park, a lake, sports fields, lovely paths to discover and several places to eat and drink. The London zoo is also locaten in the park (but you have to pay entry to go there).The area in which Regent's Park is located is lovely, quieter than the center of London and with lots of lovely buildings around. Definitely a Sunday must, especially if it's sunny!

Live theatre in beautiful park. Although visiting Regents Park many times, I never realised that there was such a wonderful outdoor theatre in it. We were taken by friends to see Seven Brides for Seven Brothers and were overwhelmed with the theatre, sound, lighting, and covered area containing a large bar and food service. Excellent seating in the theatre and plenty of room to take a picnic outside the theatre also. Only 10 minutes walk from Marylebone Road. We had a fantastic night here and despite the rain (they stopped the show and we stood in the covered bar for 5 minutes before the show restarted) this is a real gem so close to the centre of London.P.S. Excellent show, Seven Brides for Seven Brothers; very professional and excellent stage managing.

Green parks!. A beautifully laid out park. The broad pathways and established trees are great. Looking at this and the other London parks gives me great pleasure. In Australia, we should have more parks like this instead of every new city councillor wanting to pave over or bituminise , put in wider roads etc.

you can catch the waterloo line at the south end of the park and head down easily to trafalger square. Being a geek I took the tube up to Abbey Road, and then back down to 221B Bakers St. to see the Sherlock Holmes museum. Strolled the park afterward. Not sure any were worth making a special trip, but if you've seen the big sites, and your an Anglophile, make the trip.

Awesome park. Regent park is very lovely place and it's my favourite park in London . Especially in spring . I really like the flower design in park and the fountains. Also, there is a beautiful lake with swan and it was my first time See black swan .It's very beautiful place for family picnic and couple.(:

Smaller than Hyde Park+Kensington Palace, but the biggest royal park in London by itself!!. Once you left busy Oxford Street to head toward north, you'll see this big garden. It is popular for rose garden in the middle, but for local peeps it is daily jog/walk spot or for students it is playground for football/soccer/rugby. In rose garden, you'll find various kinds of rose that have different colour and shape. I really recommend to go BreadShop to buy some breads and grab a coffee, and do picnic there in fine day!! And if you can, visiting open theater is also interesting!
Great Park. Such a nice place to spend a moment in London. Many different types of gardens from large open grassy fields to perfectly manicured flowerbeds.

Nice place. It is an advantage that it is in the city centre. The park is very a relaxing area. All ages can find something there. You can walk, see the birds, squirrels, ducks, pigeons, and all others. It is a pity the lake is dirty.

Squirrels. Bring some nuts for squirrels! The park itself is very well maintained, and even if busy there is no sense of overcrowding. The squirrels are everywhere, and willing to come closer if you have a treat. Great for families.

London at its best!. Regent's Park is really beautiful all year around! In October it hosts the most awaiting Art exhibition and in the summer some Festival take place. It is very close to the London Zoo and can be access by the Regent's Canal which is a lovely walk, when it does not rain. The gardens are quite beautiful and full of roses...
Beautiful gardens & Park. Always worth a quiet walk through Regents Park. Close to Central London & lovely areas of London you can feel lost inside these gardens & park.

Great walk. Great place to hang out with friends and go for walks/run. Being a really big park, there are multiple areas where you can relax, work out or play outdoor games with friends. Definitely a good place to visit
My favourite park in London . I always come here when I feel like I need to relax! The park is huge and absolutely amazing! Lot of opportunities for outdoor activities !!!

great park. glad to have this park next to my house. always clean and full of people
going there to run sometimes
Just lovely. Beautifully well kept park. Nice and peaceful on a weekday morning, the Regent's cafe does great breakfast. Great place to have a break from busy London.
Worth visiting. Not much more than a nice park located centrally in London worth visiting at xmas for the xmas fair which is simply huge - a place to get away from the chaos of londons streets

Great lounge park.. Take a stroll through here and check out the amazing rose gardens and if you can, a show at the amphitheater. There's plenty of grass and benches provided to sit for awhile. Pedestrian paths encircle the park, it's really nice if you have the time.
clean, nice and relaxing!. great walk, nice view, relaxing environment, very clean, excellent for families and coupless, lot's of people on a Sunday morning, great place to go!

Must Do!!. Our hotel was a minute from Regent Park.It was a lovely morning,and after breakfast we walked around the whole park,to work off the calories..Very photogenic so take your camera and very enjoyable.

Beautiful park to acclimate to time change. We enjoyed walking through Regent's Park during the Tube strike this summer :). The Park is well-marked and maintained, and provides a respite from the surrounding urban areas.

Favorite Park in London. Beautiful and accessible park with lovely trails. People watch at the duck pond, play sports on the back fields, take a jog around the park. Regent's Park offers lots of options for both active and inactive visitors.
Lovely park. Definitely the most beautiful park in London, large amount of stuff going on, be prepared for at least few hours of walking around
Visit to the zoo.. Went to the zoo at Regent's Park. Good choice of food in the food hall to meet all tastes . Smoked salmon bagel especially nice!

Lovely and wonderful visit . Spent a day to walk along the river and enjoy the sun. Visited the park and enjoy some quiet moments there. Cant believe there is such a place not far from city centre of London.
A lovely park for walks. As our hotel was quite near the park we walked in the park quite a few times during our visit to London. We enjoyed it every time (don't miss Queen Mar's garden).
Lovely. Lovely big park to walk around. The rose gardens are gorgeous and really well maintained. You can even spend a sunny afternoon sitting and watching people play tennis.
Excellent park - lots gong on. Great park with large amount going on. Has London zoo in the far corner and then can walk onto the buzz of Camden
Beautiful :). By fair the best park in London! Only a short distance from the centre of London. It is a perfect place to take a picnic on a sunny day :)
Place to Picnic. A wonderful place for relaxation and picnic with the family and friends after shopping for food at Camden Market.
One of London's Best Parks. Easily one of London's best parks, beautifully maintained and with plenty of activity options including a very close proximity to London Zoo.
Lovely walk!p. Lovely place to take a walk! It is a scenic peaceful place. The kids truly enjoyed the walk through the park!
Must-visit. Romantic landscaping that leaves one dreamy. Perfect for photo ops. This handsome park hosts the (now) annual Food Fair in June which I highly recommend.

Beautiful park in zone 2. This park has paths that take you past fountains, benches, and beautiful plants/flowers. It is perfect for picnics, leisurely strolls, and even playing sport with your friends.

Beautiful place. I've never been to Regent's Park but wow what a beautiful location for a summers day out.The stunning Georgian houses that surround the park are amazing !! I didn't realise how big the park was until we looked at the map & it even has a boating lake but we didn't get that far.The gardens are so beautiful & immaculate with lots of bright stunning flowers with water fountains.It was a lovely hot day & while you sit & relax you forget you are in the middle of London.Its a very peaceful space & as you walk more into the parkland you see lots of joggers & dog walkers.We saw families enjoying picnics & people playing footie & cricket.The locals are very lucky to have this place to relax in & enjoy.I would definitely recommend this place if you are visiting London & considering it's free you can't go wrong.I would say though it's a place to go in the summer & not the winter.Also you can visit another garden called the queens Mary but we didn't go in & you have to pay to go in.Also you can get to the zoo through Regent's Park if you follow the signs.We really enjoyed the park & as the sun was shining we could sit on a bench & relax.A good place to visit if you are a people watcher.

Magic in Regents Oark. This is a beautiful park. There are maps to guide visitors to different gardens. A highlight is the open air theatre that operates each summer. It is a magical experience - and had lovely facilities for dining and having picnics.
Nice. This is where Regents University is. My daughter attending for semester. Place is beautiful. Must see if in area

Relax and enjoy one of London's green spaces. What a beautiful London Park. Take a stroll through the lovely gardens, or take a picnic and sit and watch the world go by. A relaxing oasis in the middle of a big city.
Open Air Theater was a Dream!. Great show in a beautiful setting with yummy burgers served on individual wooden boards ... This event exceeded expectations for me and my family of five.
Paradise in the heart of London. Whether you want to take a walk, stroll around or have a picnic, this is the best escape from London's hustle and bustle!

Lovely place. Although we only used the park to reach the Zoo from the Tube, it added greatly to the enjoyment of our day out. It is beautiful, peaceful and iconic. Our girls had fun taking photos in front of the floral displays and it was a joy just too walk through the park. A lovely place and we wished we had been able to spend longer there.

Must see I love and live next to it. Everyone visiting London has to go to Regents Park!!! Is like going to Paris and not visiting Ifale Tower ! Is beautiful and there is a zoo as well . Perfect for family, or just morning run . Hey best place to meet some one! You can spend all day there ,you my be lucky they are free yoga session in the park.You can't rent chairs or just bring your blanket, have a picnic!
So relaxing. Run, have a picnic, cycle, go for a walk... Very relaxing. It is a very good place to go IF its is not raining of course

For a relaxing afternoon.... Beautiful park for a relaxing afternoon lying on the chaise longue or feeding the ducks or enjoy playing football on the huge grass area. There is also a kids play area that they can play safely while you are enjoying your coffee.

Brilliant temporary get-away from Central London!. This park is perhaps not as frequently mentioned as Hyde Park or St James's Park, but is equally beautiful. It is a great place for walking, running and relaxing. My wife and I had a lovely stroll here last week and will return again when visiting London. Highly recommended!

Don't forget the parks of London!. Whilst on a recent trip over I stayed a short distance from Regent's Park. Wanting a run I headed out and when through the gates off Marylebone Road, you enter a green oasis that is just vast and fabulous. I covered the approx 6km circumference, but also cut through some of the gardens in the middle, the pond with families on pedalos and the playing fields; you'd never know you were in the middle of London. It's a lovely place and if you're going to London Zoo, make sure you wander back through to catch the tube on the other side of the park. It's one not to miss!
Roses, roses and more roses!. An excellent garden to visit - so many different flower beds to enjoy and the roses - just beautiful! Topiary and fountains as well to enjoy.
Simply Delightful. The best and most beautiful park in London. It is a delight, flower beds are stunning in colors and arrangements and the Queen Rose Circle simply enchanting visually and offaly.

Lovely walks!. Come here for an escape from the usual city views in London. Absolutely stunning in the spring and summer months with lovely flowers springing up and squirrels darting around. Perfect for a leisurely stroll with friends or family, or for a run in the park.

A very special park. We spent hours walking through Regents park, which is well kept. One day we spent time on the boating lake rowing, which was great fun for all the family, it wasn't cheap though. On another day we walked through the park to London zoo, which was a nice start to the day. There were other families walking in the park as well as many people jogging, we felt safe here.

Not as crowded as the more central parks. If you're in northwest London, you should certainly spend a bit of time here. It's far less crowded and touristy than Hyde Park, and it's right by Camden Town, which is a great place to visit in itself.
Convenient and beautiful and diverse mid-London public park. Having read about it and seen photos fails to compare to the beauty and great vibe of Regent's Park on a Sunday afternoon.

A Beautiful Location in the Center of London. Regent Park is great on a sunny day. We went to the outdoor theatre, which was terrific. Food service leaves a lot to be desired, so picnic or eat before or after.

Brilliant Open Air Theatre. The most wonderful production of 7 Brides for 7 Brothers. Although any of the theatrical presentations are excellently done at this exciting venue. Truly memorable and cannot recommend it highly enough. Not to be missed when in London.

Very Nice Place to Spend a Summer Day. I'm a little biased because I went on a very pretty day, but I was very impressed. Regent's Park is a well-manicured, pleasant park. Great place to spend a summer day.

Impeccable gardens. Impeccably maintained with beautiful gardens. The cafe by the tennis courts was great value and in such a lovely setting. Every where you turned there was something new and beautiful to gaze upon. Well worth a visit.

Place to get away form the hustle and bustle of London City. Fabulous place to relax and unwind and get some exercise, lovely walks, flowers and fresh air. Nice places to have coffee there also. If you had young kids it would be a great place to rent some bikes and take them for a cycle, safe and relaxing.

A great London park. London parks are rightly famous and often overlooked by tourists. Regents Park is one of my favourites, either to walk in the Queen Mary Rose Gardens, or play games with friends, but most of all to meet up for a evening picnic.
You can walk there from Camden or Baker Street tube.
Enjoy :)
Walk A Little While Longer.. Nice and Clean Park. Good for a Light Jog Or a Long Walk With Friends or Your Sweetheart. Bring an Umbrella.

Quiet and beautiful. I really like this park, it's not as crowded as Hyde Park, Kensington Gardens or Green Park. It's more peaceful, but also beautiful. St Mary's Gardens has wonderful collection of roses.
Love it!. Close to London's city center, Regent's park is a nice place to sit and rest, especially after long walk around the city.

Lovely park. We had a walk through the park on one of those nice summer days, it is a beautiful park, lots of things to see, quite peaceful. Beautiful arranged flowers and a a bit different from the Outer Circle , makes it worth a walk in itself.
Beautiful. Another park which we love for our picnics and enjoy when weather is good in London. This park is beautiful.

A walk to do, a pleasure to seize. This garden is one of the most beautiful parks I have walked through. It's kept wonderfully and when there is the chance to smell and admire a huge variety of roses in full blossom (which was the case at end of August) it is really a treat. Highly recommended

Wonderful place for a wander. We just had a simple wander, lots of space and interesting things to see. We had a nice lunch in the Smokehouse and walked it off with a wander. Nice things to see and people playing football bits of history and space.
Escape from the busy streets of London. Escape from the busy streets of London. A nice green retreat in the City. Overall very clean and with something for everybody.
RELAXING WALK. Regent Park is so relaxing after all the hussle and bussle of London, it is so nice to walk round it .
Must see!. Such a beautiful escape from the hustle & bustle of the London traffic. So nice to walk through & very peaceful.
10-day Holiday in London. It is strange coming from Belgium to see such a large park in the center of London. It is a site for a moment of relaxation after the hectic high streets in the neighborhood

Walking in the rain. Visited Regents Park during a walking tour of London. It is a beautiful green oasis and very peaceful. Even though it was pouring with rain during our visit, the gardens were fabulous. Very well cared for with plenty of facilities, ie places to eat and toilets. Good place for a picnic if the weather is good.
Nice break from the city. Kids liked the playground & fountains. Was quite surprised at trash in some spots but overall a very nice oasis.

Wide open spaces with a surprise centre . Fabulous park, very well cared for and well appointed, loads of space for runners and dog walkers, and a good range of wildlife including the London Park parakeet syndrome, but the main reason for our visit was the outdoor theatre which is situated in the centre of the park, this year's offering was "Seven Brides for Seven Brother's " which was outstanding, all served up with BBQed burgers and jugs of Pimm's, all in all a great evenings entertainment.
Just relax. Nice park to relax after a busy day in London. Spacious and with a great coffee bar (Benugo). Don't forget to walk to Primrose Hill for the view.

fabulous place! my favourite park in London!. this is not the typical park like Hyde Park or Green Park with more greenery and simple paths and a lake - this is a park with a little something for everyone! come here for a picnic, a stroll around the lake, admire the extensive rose garden, visit the London Zoo, etc. you can easily spend an afternoon here and have a great time!
beautiful. such a beautiful place to wonder round. It is definitely worth a visit if you are having a day out in London. We had a mini picnic whilst here.
Paradise. One of the best parks in London...if not the Best, clean, colourful, diverse and safe...I would recommend especially in summer
Great London Park. One of the many nice parks in Central London that has a number of activities and where the famous London Zoo is located.
The English trees are glorious. Walked for miles through this glorious park which was packed with tourists enjoying a beautiful sunny day.

Gorgeous park! Parc magnigique!. This park is not too far from St Pancras train station (in the North of London). Definitely worth stopping by! It is giant, gorgeous and you can get a very nice view from London at Primrose Hill, even if the weather is a bit rainy (trust us !). Some parts are wonderful such as the Queen Mary’s Gardens with its roses. Quieter than Hyde Park. You should definitely make the time to walk there ! Ce parc est situé dans le nord de Londres, pas trop loin de la gare de St Pancras et vaut la peine de s’y arrêter. Si vous marchez jusqu’à Primrose Hill, vous pourrez y admirer une belle vue de Londres et ce, même si le temps est pluvieux. Ce parc est très divers et comprend des coins magnifiques (roseraie, etc). Beaucoup plus calme que Hyde Park. Allez-y!
Love at first sight. Gorgeous!!! Beautifully maintained. having pints of beer...scones....pizza...... Its kinda unbelievable that this is even possible. Greener than green..

Best Park in London. Better than Hyde park - Believe me!!! Hyde park was hyped. The park was not crowded even on Saturday evening. The ducklings, silent surroundings and awesome boating made me day there.

One of the best. Between all the royal park Regent's Park is personal opinion the best one, went there several times, you know it's rarely sunny in London so we don't want to miss chances to enjoy the sun

Great place for a picnic. Great place for a picnic but if you arrive unprepared there's a restaurant which sells picnics to go with some choice as to what's included. Really enjoyed lying on the grass and walking through the gardens. Not as busy as Hyde Park too
Lovely garden gorgeous flowers. Plan ahead and gave a picnic lunch at the park. Gorgeous flowers and fountains. A must visit in London. Would recommend a weekday as I am sure weekends are very busy
beautiful park. lovey park in the heart of London great if you want to have a walk with your dog and the family or just on your own
Very nice. Very nice Park to walk and relax. Squirrels to feed and pet, if u catch them. Quite Park with huge rose collection.

Lovely Park with a beautiful and colourful flower garden. Just walked through and impressed with the green spread and the flower garden in the middle of the park was really in full blossom and wonderful. Must see I say!!

Picnic. There were deck chairs available and I said on one only to find out that it had a been hired by someone else already. Perhaps an occupied sticker could be available. I couldn't see where to get a deck chair and I didn't want to sit on one again in case it was already hired . Lovely place by the bandstand. The herons are unafraid of human company and wander about.

so much more than a park. a big,big park with so much more going on that just the zoo.free outdoor children's play parks with safe 'child only' toilets. beautiful avenues and walkways with box hedging, water features and all year round flower displays. let's now forget the squirrels who will openly feed from your hands, be sure to take some peanuts in shells with you!quaint coffee huts scattered around selling light bites,cakes and snacks.
Beautiful Urban Landscape. Beautiful gardens and flowers. Roses were spectacular, not to be missed. People watching almost as much fun as the plants.

Would definitely go as often as possible. Went to a show in the Open Air Theatre. Apart from the weather being too hot - 30-35 degrees! - it was wonderful. The gardens surrounding the theatre are beautifully kept and there was plenty of shady areas to sit and cool down. Beautiful!
Regent's park. Lindo parque, assim como todos, os outros na Europa. São verdadeiros cartões postais.Beauty Park, like as all the others parks in Eroupe. They are really postal cards.
Beautiful park. Beautiful escape from the busy city. We often come here for a relaxing walk or picnic. There is always something going on! It's a beautiful park and a great place for children.

Excellent family outing. A huge park and breathtakingly beautiful, this is a wonderful park to go out with family and kids. Near Baker street, this has a beautiful lake and so many flowers abound. A must see all round and more so in Autumn.

One of my Fav!. Love it... It is huge, very elegant and peaceful.
I didn't have the chance to get to the London Zoo.. But could enjoy the real peace you can get far away from London's big noise!
relaxing. a huge park you could spend all day there on a nice day, so quite and relaxing, great for all couples, familys, joggers. ect

Peace and quiet. Wonderful place, Ducks, geese, swans and pigeons, For families- boating on the lake, also great place for jogging, walking, So peaceful and serene, one can sit and look at the birds for hours.
A beautiful oasis of quietness. We spent about four hours in this beautiful park, after the visit at Madame Tussaud museum. Nice floral arrangements and a small garden dedicated to princess Diana.

Beautiful Park. Stopped here before visiting Baker Street and had a wonderful afternoon. This is a large beautiful park with wonderful gardens, some outdoor performances, a large lake, places to relax and play. I really enjoyed spending the afternoon here. We rented some pedal-boats and enjoyed exploring the lake for a while. Really a nice change of pace from sightseeing while you're visiting.
Very Nice and English. Large, beautiful park in London. Just a nice quiet place to visit, walk and relax. I would recommend a stroll this beautiful park.

other countries take note. this is one heck of an amazing space, why the excellent rating, if like us , have travelled other European cities and like parks, this in the capital city is a show case of how a park should be, recreation for the locals, chill out ares for visitors and then formal gardens which are fabulous and those roses....wow.well done to the royal parks for maintaining such a fabulous outside space in one of the worlds busiest cities
green space in the city. Apart from the zoo the park has ponds plants and pleasant walks away from the traffic and bustle of central London
Quite and beautiful place. Lovely area. Very good to spend a time walking around, enjoying the view. Park is beatiful and peaceful.

Beautiful park . I've been here many times before always with my family and we have always enjoyed it. It's quite a big park with a play area for kids and the lake that you can go on boat rides. The cafe is terrible though I must say. Nothing that looks half good to eat.

nice place to relax. if you are looking for relaxing afternoon, this is the best place. The park has a lake with a lot of ducks, kids may enjoy feeding the ducks, take some bread with you. Also , there is a small restaurant servicing some burgers and pizza and some beverages. You may ride mini boats and do some paddling, or you may want to do run round the beautiful garden.

Never disappoints - excellent for musicals. We have been to Regents Park Open Air Theatre many times and it never disappoints. The musicals are always top notch. However, this time we won tickets, which included a Luxury Hamper. The Hamper was great, including the champagne, which we shared with some ladies, as there was far too much for 2 people, one of whom would be driving later. Seven Brides for Seven Brothers was a great show and I would recommend the show and the venue to anyone. I think we will also look at eating there.

Be Proud Britton of our parks. 👍👍👍👍. Here we should shout about our very beautiful parks in the middle of London. We visit London on business a lot. We always try and have a lunch or high tea here. It is very chilled and it is so big. We love to bring a picnic here and enjoy the grounds that are simply stunning. There is very little you can enjoy in London without paying a high price but this is one of them. Go and enjoy the hard work of the gardeners and keepers.
Open air theatre. Good seating configuration, excellent amenities, fabulous show, Seven Brides for seven brothers, late bar

The most beautiful park in London . If you are planning a stay in London, you can't help visiting Regent's Park.With its flowers, fountains, and colorful gardens it will allow you to have a wonderful day and to feel a sense of peace, especially during Sunday. If you pass a bridge in the north of the park, you can reach either the London Zoo or a path that will lead you to Camden Town.

Nice park.. It is a nice and quiet park, not so crowded. It is very nice to make a stroll around here. The park is well maintained and has quite some flowers. Worth visiting if you have some spare time.

Great Park. One of the attrcation where there is no entry fee. Its very big and beautiful park. This can best be covered by bicycle as walking takes long time. Must see for those who likes nature scenary

Great. Pleasant area to walk and chill out, nothing to dislike. Ate at the sausage house, food was freshly cooked but, nothing to shout about, 3 burgers and a cumberland sausage hot dog, 3 cans 1 cup of tea £33. The food didn't really give the yum yum factor.

Sanctuary in a city. The one thing that London has to be proud of are the lovely parks. this one always has an area where I can sit and relax. My dog loves it too. well worth a visit, perhaps for a picnic after going to London zoo or having been in madam tussards as both close by. Lovely canal runs through it also.
What a great park. this one is easy for us, as we live close by, just a short walk, its big and green and the place place in it is the rose garden.

the prettiest park in london. I love this place.
Much less crowded than Hyde Park, you have the Zoo, Baker St, Primrose Hill and Camden at a stone's throw away. Plenty to do as a solo traveler, couple, family or friends.
Gardens inside and the theatre in summer are superb.
You will find a few places for refreshments and snacks.
Super-beatiful in Spring and Fall.
Pretty gardens and lake for boating. Lovely way to spend a morning or full day sitting under the trees - pretty gardens and a lake for boating

Excellent park for a day or more out in the fresh air.. This is a huge park with plenty of different areas to visit, we spent best part of a day wandering around and still didn't see everything. There are plenty of map sign boards around to help you visit the places you most want to.
A moment to relax.. Urban refuge from the noisy city for reading a book, outdoor meal or cycling. Surrounded by The Canal, it also features London ZOO and beautiful gardens.

How could you not love it. How can you not love regents park. It's huge. Great for picnics with freinds. Or lovely to just hire a deck chair and sit by the water. Take a bottle of wine and watch the ducks.
Lovely place for a stroll or picnic. One of London's premier parks. Can get crowded in the summer, but lovely for a stroll any time of year.
pretty. so very pretty. feed the ducks. relax, take a picnic, people watch. do it with style. this is the place to be.
amazing time. the park was amazing nice , the weather was nice over there , the best thing is the cycling over it ever where you can find that .
One of the most central parks in London, must visit. One of the biggest and most central parks in London. They also do lots of activities and meetups from Dancing to other sport gathering.
Peace and Quiet. joyed Regent's Park. The Rose Garden, Pedalos and hiring a deck chair for an hour by the band stand....lovely!

Relaxation. You can not ask more of a park...a theater, stunning gardens, ponds...........Roses season is spectacular as seen nowhere
The meadows are excellent....and neighbor to park a zoo
The best of a cosmopolitan city

Beautiful, green, quiet place to run and walk. I ran here every day of my recent work trip. I was surprised by how large and beautiful this park is. I am used to running in Hyde Park. The greens were clean, the paths lovely, lots of runners and people with their dogs. I especially loved the English Garden, and the zoo on the perimeter. If you are near Regents and need an oasis from the city its certainly worth it. Its free, its green, and it immediately takes you away from the hubbub of the city!

A place to relax and watch the day slip away!. Regent's Park is a great place to sit with a good book and a picnic in the sunshine, whilst you watch the day slip away from you or go along with a group of friends and visit the ZSL zoo before spending time in the park.

Beautiful park for a stroll!. We went here on a summery day for a walk. Beautiful park, wonderful flowers and sit-down areas. We recommend hitting the 'photogenic' spots marked on the maps throughout the park.

A nice day at the park. Had a nice picnic with friends, we played all day. Bought some nice food from home. The children were very happy because they could play as well in the children area.Will do it again when the weather is better.

One of Londons jewels. Regents Park is a jewel of London. The park is free to visit however parking can be costly in the surrounding areas. There is plenty of space to run scream and shout or if your looking for a bit of peace and quiet theirs plenty of quiet areas too. If you have time you can visit London Zoo or take in a production at the summer open air theatre.
Peaceful Heaven. If you are in London you can't miss a peaceful walk in this park.Green space, lakes, flowers, squirrels and ducks everywhere, perfect place to go on a warm sunday morning.

Beautiful, peaceful and quiet - perfect for a weekend stroll. Their gardens are stunning and are always well-kept, so it is an absolute pleasure to stroll around or simply lie down on the grass. Regent's Park is usually not too crowded as some other London Parks and is therefore great if one just wants some peace and quite of the big city.
Large park north of Oxford Street. Lovely big park north of oxford street. Love the variety of greens, vegetation, cafe, and the zoo. Must visit if visiting London in the summer.
Great. Can be too crowded and take over by film crews - the park is almost three different parks in one so do explore all four corners.

Great Park, shame they now charge for toilets. Regents Park is an outstanding park with so many aspects. Very well maintained sports pitches, lovely rose gardens, great lakes for boating or water gardens. Capel Manor College runs high quality gardening courses.
I removed 1 point as they have recently started charging for toilet access
Enjoyable walk. Lovely lake with paddle boats to hire. We enjoyed a nice scenic walk to the ZSL Zoo! If your lucky you can see some of the animals from the park i.e Giraffes.

A haven in busy London.. This is one of the most beautiful parks I have been to. Well worth a visit when you come to London. Tranquil, peaceful, clean and tidy.
There are many "garden rooms" to visit and chill out in. My favorite would have to be the roses and the long walkways brimming with colourful perennial borders. Photographers delight.
Close to major attractions and very agreable. Nice to walk around . Beuatiful flowers, statues and a good place to eat your fruit or sandwich looking at the moviment.
beautiful place. beautiful place! happened to be awesome weather which i spose helps, a re-occuring attraction with friends and family

Gardens are lovely and well kept!. So lovely and well kept. We enjoyed an afternoon in the sunshine here. The grounds are fantastic and well worth the trip there to relax on a blanket in the grass. I think visiting and hanging out in the parks in London was one of my favorite things to do!

Best park in London. The best royal park in London by miles. It offers everything you may want from a park, ranging from a lake, to a flower park to football fields. Regent's Park is the most versatile, beautiful and well-kept park in London.
Beautiful. Beautiful walk with the partner! Lovely views... Lots of lovely scenery and wild life! Easy access to all areas of London

Restull place in the middle of crowdy and noisy town. If you have to take a break from crowd, noise, traffic and tourist attractions, have an hour or to in the park. You can just lye down on the lawn, sit in the coffee bar or take children to the playground. There is a huge collection of free walking birds for those who are interested in bird watching.
Amazing!. Queen Mary's gardens (inside the Inner Circle) are especially wonderful! The beautiful example of type of English garden

Beautiful walks - even in the rain. Stayed in Marylebone Village which is a short walk from Regent's Park. Unfortunately our walk was interrupted by rain but it was gentle and saved by umbrellas. Beautiful gardens, lakes and bird life including many ducks. Strategically placed beds of flowers and both manicured lawns and "wilderness" ( well comparatively!)
Place to relax. Beautiful for long walks and much quieter that other parks. We had a pick nick here this summer and it was very romantic!

A garden lover's delight.. A beautiful expanse of lush greenery and gardens. Love the roses and other stunning collection of flowers. Great for families and for having a day out...in the city and yet away from the city atmosphere. Centrally located and easy access to enjoy lunch or a coffee.

Beautiful, family-friendly, convenient. Wanted to have a place to relax, with a play ground, after having visited The British Museum with our two small children. The Park was massive and very well kept, with a fantastic playground an a cafe that offered a decent selection of sandwiches and a surprisingly good coffee. An oasis amidst the city's hustle and bustle.

Beautiful London Greenspace. London has a number of large and very beautiful gardens. Regent's Park is one of the most attractive. Situated in the central area Zone 1 (well technically it is North West London). You can get there by getting the tube to Regents Park station, or if you are in the area sightseeing at Madam Tussauds or the Sherlock Holmes Museum, you can walk there from Baker Street. It has a number of beautiful Rose Gardens and the park is also home to the London Zoo. It is large, covering around 395 acres, so there is plenty of space to relax and unwind away from the London traffic.

A quiet, peacefull place away from the hustle and bustle.. This was our first visit to Regent's Park. Although it is near the busy streets and shops of London, on entering it, you will find a tranquil time will be had as you walk around, admiring the gardens and flowers. Very peaceful and relaxing place.
The most beautiful. Beautiful central London park with a Zoo, lake, open air theatre, rose garden, sculptures. The Nash terraces make it special.

Fun time. We came here for a day out with our friends, the day was what can I say, love ever bit of it, getting together our friends was great, the sun was out, catching up what more could we have asked for
Open air concert. The Open air theatre is situated in Regents Park itself and is a great venue. It is really atmospheric and we' would definitely go there again.
The best outdoor in London. The only place I know where the city noise disappears and often one doesnt even see the BT Tower. Gren, Flowers, Treas, Lakes, Music, Rest. What do you want more?

Beautiful breath of fresh air. Despite the 'marvellous' UK summer weather (ie clouds and rain!) I was determined to take my teens to Regent's park for a picnic. As soon as you walk through the gates from Bakers Street station the noise and craziness of London just melts away. There were copious benches all along the lake with views of the bird life. It's a place to watch the world go by, although you can be more active hiring pedalos! (£28 for a family) We took a stroll up to the playground which was excellent for maybe under 13's although my 16 year olds had fun! The toilets were immaculate that were nearby, unfortunately not having 20p to pay to get in them we didn't get to actually sit on them at all! So bring your change unlike me. We only explored a tiny part of this huge park, you could definitely spend a day when the weather is kinder, even just to clear your head from the city sounds.
Nice park. Nice park to walk around. Lots nearby. Baker street,Royal academy of Music museum, sherlock homes museum
Amazing walk. Great place to walk around..Wonderful area.Very relaxing. very central london as well. Easy access and kids friendly
Best Park in London. Regents park is just wonderful - I would highly recommend a walk or run through here when visiting London

Fantastic place for a day out. This is amazing stretch of greenery, and absolute must-do for me around June/July months when the Inner circle is covered with heavenly smelling roses in all sizes and colours. I have been there on my own, with family and with friends, and had a good time every time. There cafes are well spaced. the loo facilities decent, so it really makes it a fun place to relax and be amidst nature and greenery without leaving London!
Good place for a day out. Nice place for a day out with family. My daughter loved it and so many things to do. It's a place to relax and chill

My favourite London park. Beautiful flower beds, always look well tended. The rose garden is gorgeous when the flowers are in full bloom. Love the outdoor theatre, have seen some great productions, the latest being 'Seven Brides for Seven Brothers', which was super.
Nice London Park. Nice big park, Rose gardens worth a visit, good for bird watching. Big areas to play sports - also next to London Zoo.
Lovely. Really loved this park, very scenic and kept nice. Really pretty and peaceful. Could have walked round here all day as it is bigger than you think.

Theatre in the Park. Regent's Park is a beautiful park with an excellent outdoor theatre. This jewel of a theatre provides great sight lines from just about every seat. The sets were cleverly done and enhanced the overall experience. There are a variety of dining options to enjoy before the show. What a wonderful evening!

The Rose Garden. If you are a rose enthusiast this is paradise on earth. I visited it early one morning. From the early morning hustle and bustle of London this feels as though you have stepped into the country. Fabulous selection of David Austin roses.

a pleasant break. This very large park was a 2 minutes walk from Sherlock Holmes home..221 Baker Street. We only walked around part of it. There was a very large pond/lake..many lovely flower beds, tons of birds/ducks, large grassy fields, benches, paddle boats to rent and more.
Bring a picnic. A lovely British venue where you can sit, have a picnic and watch the world go by. Make sure, being England, that you don't forget your umbrella

Beautiful park for all to enjoy. Enormous park and some stunning floral displays, ice creams,coffee, snacks are all available in the park. It was lovely to see so many people enjoying the park, runners, cyclists, picnickers, dog walkers and families just enjoying the space....a lovely park 😀
Relaxing. Clean and well cared for. We visited on a very warm day and there was plenty of shade to sit and just people watch.
Relaxing Sunday. Great park with a wide variety of gardens. Fun boating pond too... We certainly didn't feel like we were in the centre of London !!! Definitely recommend.

Lovely place for a relaxing walk in London.. Great place to enjoy an evening walk. You can even have a picnic on the grass, a jog around the park or walk your dog. Also, you can see the ducks on the lake and have a look at the ZSL zoo.
Watch out for the squirrels. Used to use it more before they charged for parking on Sundays, need better provision to cycle, open air theatre is fantastic in summer.

Majical on a summers day. This park is firstly so huge, and many different parts to it.
The lake is the best park for us, and the restaurant.
Great to wander through, or even drive into and then wander round.
Great surene place in the heart of a busy large city

Favourite park in London. This is my absolute favourite park in London. Absolutely beautiful and even when quite crowded it's still lovely for a stroll around. Bring a picnic and a rug and have a lazy afternoon.

Huge and serene. We only dipped into the corner of this park, but would have loved to explore it further. This park could well be worth at least half a day, especially for families (with the zoo, boat rides, etc.) The formal gardens we walked through on the way to the playground were so well tended and beautiful, and the noise of London around fades pretty quickly as you walk in. This was definitely a worthwhile stop to let the kids run around a bit and to recharge everyone's batteries. We walked up from the British Museum which I wouldn't recommend - seemed like it wouldn't be that far on the map but was really quite a walk (which meant we didn't spend as much time in the park, bummer).

Lovely park in posh area of central London. I used to go frisbee throwing in the park while at University College London with the UCL frisbee club. I fell in love with the park and have been so ever since. Given it's location, a smaller but perhaps posher alternative to Hyde Park.
Lovely and relaxing. Nice to get away from the hustle and bustle of London. A pleasant stroll and also recommend a visit to the outdoor theatre.
English garden at its best.. Soft, green, colorful, and so lovely. A place to relax and enjoy beautiful beautiful garden. Do not miss!

Is this the best park in London? Yes. Have visited this park many times and every time see something new. Having lived in a London all my life pleased to write this review. Go visit, take a rug and picnic and sit and watch the world go by. A great way to spend a few hours.

Great traditional park. Beautiful park and great for people watching. The cafes expensive and food unimpressive - take a picnic and site in the rose garden instead. My only gripe is that they don't allow roller blades....

How do you review a park?. Lovely peaceful place with lots of birds, two boating lakes, several cafes and more herons than I've ever seen in one place. We spent an hour just wandering while the rest of our group were strugglng with the crowds at Tussauds just around the corner. A real escape!

Most beautiful park in London. Lovely for an afternoon stroll. This park has ponds, rose gardens and finely sculpted shrubbery. The ambiance is very relaxing even though it's so close to the hustle and bustle of central London
Great family escape. Lovely park very close to the mosque, also there are many areas to explore with children. Nice caffee and you can even have a boat ride on the lake.

Great park to have a walk or just relax. Regent's Park is huge and green. In the summer, that is the perfect location to take a nap before hanging out in the crowded streets of Camden market, that you can reach following the canal. When the weather is humid, you can just walk around the park and enjoy the peaceful atmosphere in it, contrasting with the speed life of London !
Great place. Probably the most beautiful park in London.There are no tourists and is kept for Londoners, just avoid Friday afternoon as it is too busy.

One of London's Premier Parks. This is a great park, catering for a wide public cross-section. The park is well maintained with exceptional facilities and many features leading to an enjoyable stay. The hanging (swagged) rose garden is beautiful and the natural planting around the water features really interesting. The attraction of many species of bird adds a delight for the birdwatcher.

Great day(s) out. Regent's Park is a great place to get away from the city life (even tho it is placed in the middle of the city).You have a lot of space to play with the kids/ friends, relax as a couple or just walk around and go for a boat tour, if you are a person who needs to be active.We are going to the park on a regular basis as it is, in my opinion, one of the better parks in London.Take your time and walk around :)

Theatre Lovers take note!!!. The Open Air Theatre is a must visit. I saw 7 Brides for 7 Brothers 10 days ago and it was brilliant. Having seen the film many times I was doubtful whether it could be emulated but it was wonderful. Hurry if you want to see it - last day is 29th August 2015.
Peaceful Park. We enjoyed walking around this beautiful park , it's so peaceful and relaxing if you have free hours in the day , you can walk through the park reaching London Zoo.
A calm oasis. beautifully tended by the expert gardeners and full of wildlife. The open air theatre adds so much and is a must when its open for the season - take in a play!
GREEN SPACE. Lovely open spaces - open air theatre - beautiful gardens with wonderful roses and many herbaceous plants- playing areas to hire and so close to shops
Serenity at the end of a long day!. For a traveller/tourist, I found this to be a serene park after making so many stops at other attractions sites and in need of some rest.

Regent's Park!. I love this place so much! Always great to come play pickup football with people, take a walk with family, and it is a brilliant place to take a run as well, so spacious and so many routes to take that it never gets boring!

A Green Oasis in the Heart of London. Only about 15 mins walk from Oxford Circus, with it's own circular ring road and surrounded by grand villas; Regents Park is a green lung, a peaceful getaway. This park is huge and very well tended. Simply delightful and relaxing. (You can also find the London Zoo here). We all agreed the Park was the best bit of this day out.

Great place for a walk or run.. Very easy to forget you're in the middle of London. Spacious, well-planned park with lots of trails. My wife and I did a 10K run one morning there and met lots of friendly people and their dogs.

Huge Park which is a treat to explore and enjoy. This park is very big . You can stroll around and enjoy the wide open spaces. There's a boating lake to enjoy. Many games of cricket to watch and a great Open Air theatre tucked away in the corner which is a wonderful venue on a summers evening.Close to the Baker St station or Regents Park Underground.Visit the magnificent water fountain in the middle or enjoy a drink and ice cream. Loos cost 20p.
Gorgeous. Excellent atmosphereI sent the family to Madam T. Museum and waited reading a book while around me ducks seagull etcgorgeous
beautiful. this is a really lovely park pleanty of places to sit and relax there is a place to eat beautiful flowers this park is so beautifully kept walked the park on the way to the zoo

Beautiful park!. Regent's Park is massive and one can actually get lost as its that huge. That being said, it's also so beautiful and well maintained that you may not mind getting lost as there's so much to see! It's so relaxing to take a leisurely walk through the park - can't wait to come back.
Lovely park for relaxing. great park near the hotel for wandering, letting the kids chase pidgeons, feeding ducks, eating ice cream and generally relaxing. Zoo is here as well but we did not go.

Clean and beautiful park. Me and my friends regularly go to regent's park to have a picknick. Its a very clean, quiet and beautiful park and its great if you just want to lay down somewhere with a book and relax.

Stellar!. This was a really great park! Firstly, even though we visited late in the season the gardens still looked great! Once we got into the middle of the park I could barely hear any traffic and could almost forget we were in the city There are great paths though the trees and flower gardens. The best thing for us is that there is a playground that is designed for older kids. We've been to a few here in the city but most seem to be laid out for younger children.

Lovely Place to Chill. Always wanted to visit Regent's Park ever aince watching 101 Dalmatians as a kid.Spent a lazy afternoon at Regent's Park with my other half and had absolutely no regrets!Enjoyed the beautiful scenery and even played with the pigeons and squirrels.Skipped the London Zoo since my home country's zoo probably already one of the best.

Wide Open Spaces,Gardens & Lakes.. Regent's Park is probably less frequented than the other ' big two' ( Hyde Park & St. James's Park ) Very easy to access from numerous tube & main line stations & buses & also quite easy to park a car- if you can face getting in & out of London! For a day out why not walk/take a canal boat trip from Little Venice along the Regent's Canal to the Park? As most people realise, London Zoo sits in one corner of the Park but it's probably too much of a stretch to visit that & still have time to do justice to the Park. The bulk of the park is contained by the Outer Circle Rd. with the smaller area contained within the Inner Circle Rd. The Inner Circle contains the lovely Queen Mary Rose Garden plus a water garden surrounded by shrubs & Herbaceous beds. I don't think the Rose Garden etc is kept to such a high standard as it was in my younger days but I really do think it is still well worth visiting. There is a very large lake within the Outer Circle with a great range of birdlife to admire & feed including on my recent visit, no less than 9 Grey Herons in one spot snapping up carrot strips kindly provided by a visitor. Pedalos can be hired here & also on a smaller circular lake nearby, these for smaller children. Also many flower beds & I must say they are very imaginatively planted with great combinations of colour & shape. Wide open grass areas, statuary, sports pitches & a good few eateries & snack bars. Altogether a great place to pass a whole day, especially with children & you don't have to spend a fortune.

A place of solitude in central London. Whether summer or winter, Regent's Park is simply beautiful. Wide paths with beautiful trees never make one feel the place is over-crowded. Large and links up near Zoo to other side. Wonderful community planting areas en route with lots of friendly gardeners. fantastic photo opportunities and a cup of coffee in the park is always welcome

ONE OF LONDON'S FINEST PARKS. We spent 3 hours walking the park and it's lakes and gardens. Took a lot of bird pictures around the lakes. Easy walking. Lot's of benches to sit on and enjoy nature and people watching.

Londons most Beautiful park. Regent's Park offers everything you can wish for .Beautiful lake , spacious areas.Play areas for the kids + of course London zoo .Easily accessible by tube and bus , a must visit for the zoo or relaxing
London break. Wonderful park. Visited the open air Theatre - what a treat. Brilliant show and lovely surrounding. Tip though if you go to see a show take a jacket and/or blanket as it can get cold.
Lovely London. A very pleasant place to wander around. A green sanctuary in a vibrant wonderful city. Lots of photo op's for the flora enthusiast.
lovely. lovely walk through whilst making our way to the zoo and easy access to Camden town, great walk in the summer just s good in any season
Beautiful Park. Absolutely peaceful and beautiful. It was such a pleasure to watch swans gliding through the water as we walked among beautiful gardens. The zoo is just around the corner.

The most beautiful park London.. I've been coming here since I was a child my family had a home near by and every evening I use to go walking with my grandmother here. Now I bring my son here whenever I'm in London and it's a grate place for a family day out where the kids can play on swings or football.
Relaxing and lovely park in the centre of London City. Loved this beautiful park at the heart of London city! Very relaxing and well tended botanical gardens!
Nice and quite place to hang around.. Huge park. Nice for morning walk. The maintenance is superm. You get tyo see lots of species of birds.
Peaceful time out in the busy town. Great day out in the park, lovely gardens, gentle strolls, plenty of activity and a variety of themes. Places to eat and re-fuel.

Gem of a park. Loved walking around this park. My favourite of the bigger London parks. Varies from formal (Rose Garden) to fairly unstructured (northern areas). Specially liked the ponds with tons of birdlife. A great walk is to approach along the Regents canal and then walk south past the lakes.
Lovely and diverse landscapes. One of the joys of London is its parks, and this is amongst the best. Lovely rose garden is amongst the highlights.
Neat clean green parks!. My son loved all the park is London! Chasing the pigeons... going round and round in the merry go round! :)
Great family place.. Great place to run or walk. Wish they had drinking fountains. You can rent boats and paddle the little lake. Kids love it.
Beautiful. The gardens in the park are absolutely stunning. Take your time to walk around the paths and look at all the flowers.

A great place top stop and "smell the roses". Great place to spend a quiet afternoon. The gardens are beautiful. Lovely to look at. A great place top stop and "smell the roses" and they do smell great!
